Also-by: Matthias Sohn <matthias.sohn@sap.com>

subject: Reduce screen blinking before showing Fetch wizard
message:
Reduce screen blinking before showing Fetch wizard

Because lack of support for check box column in tables in SWT we are
using a hack in Fetch wizard to obtain image for four check box states
(enabled-checked/unchecked and disabled-checked/unchecked).

Previous implementation was creating four times a small window with
one of given check box state. Now we are including all states in
single window, then we are creating proper representation based on
part of created window.

This patch also improve overall Fetch wizard creation time.

message:

This adds some dialogs to be used for checkout and deletion of
branches which are used in the Team->Switch To...->New branch... and
Team->Switch To...->Other... Menu actions.

New Branch... will first call a dialog to select the base (branch,
tag, Reference) and then start the usual wizard with the selected base
as parameter.

Other... will open a dialog to select a branch, tag, or Reference for
checking out. Upon "Ok", the Ref is checked out.

With this, users can use specific, simplified UIs for the very common
operations of branch creation and checkout instead of having to use
the generic BranchSelectionDialog which offers too many actions.

subject: Use workspace file encoding in commit dialog diff
message:
Use workspace file encoding in commit dialog diff

When viewing the diff (from the commit dialog) of a file that has a
different encoding than the workspace encoding, it contains incorrect
changes.

One way to reproduce this problem:

- Set the Eclipse workspace encoding to ISO-8859-1.
- Create an XML file that has an explicit UTF-8 encoding set (either
  through an encoding attribute in the XML or as an explicit property on
  the resource). Add some non-ASCII characters in the file.
- Commit it.
- Change some unrelated lines in the file.
- Open the commit dialog.
- View the diff of the file.

Before this change, the diff would show changes in the lines with
non-ASCII characters, even though they didn't change. The reason is that
the encoding of nextFile is correct because it is from the workspace.
But it's wrong for baseFile because it's read as a blob from the repo,
and the diff view therefore falls back to the wrong workspace encoding.

After this change, the encoding from the IFile is also used to decode
the previous file contents, and the diff is correct.

Change-Id: I58ba71d30d7dd47068d2b212737896f6c1b9843a

subject: RFC: Teach the Sharing wizard to share with an existing Repository
message:
RFC: Teach the Sharing wizard to share with an existing Repository

THIS IS NOT COMPLETE, DO NOT MERGE!

This uses the Refactoring capabilities available in Eclipse to allow
sharing an Eclipse project with a Repository that is not located in a
parent folder of the project.

The Sharing Wizard has a new radio button to allow selection of an
existing Repository (from the RepoView) and optionally a relative path
within this repository into which the project is to be shared (always
using the project name as terminating folder).

Upon finish, the project location is then moved to the new target folder
(a child folder of the working directory of the selected
Repository) before the ConnectProviderOperation is executed.

subject: Revert "Use CompareUtils.compareHeadWithWorkspace"
message:
Revert "Use CompareUtils.compareHeadWithWorkspace"

This reverts commit 19f2cf44d7868aa2d4b5faa811af5dbbc9600a12. This
commit changed the behavior so that it opens a new top level window when
you select the 'Compare with->HEAD Revision' menu.  It used to create a
new editor.  This change in behavior is a regression since the top-level
window is disruptive to a standard multi editor workspace.  It also
means standard functions like search and editing are no longer
available. Reverting this commit fixes this regression.

subject: Fix CommonUtils.STRING_ASCENDING_COMPARATOR issues
message:
Fix CommonUtils.STRING_ASCENDING_COMPARATOR issues

The comparator provides the means to sort a list of strings using a
natural sort order (i.e. "2" before "10"). It had two problems.

The first one was that it could not handle strings that contained many
numbers (when all the numbers concatenated exceeded Integer.MAX_VALUE).
This lead to a NumberFormatException. Because the comparator is used in
CreateBranchPage, it was impossible to create a branch in a repository
that had a ref with such a name (e.g. stable-1-0-0_2011-05-25).

The second one was that it resulted in the wrong order for some inputs.
For example, the following inputs would not be sorted as listed here:

  project-1-0-0-final
  project-1-0-1-beta

With the implementation of this change, it behaves correctly for these
two problems.

Change-Id: Ie5edf268889f43c2a4497669aa1700f790cd2cdd
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>
Signed-off-by: Matthias Sohn <matthias.sohn@sap.com>

subject: Get rid of regexps in STRING_ASCENDING_COMPARATOR
message:
Get rid of regexps in STRING_ASCENDING_COMPARATOR

This makes the code both faster and easier to read (no complicated
lookahead/lookbehind pattern).

In a real-world use case for sorting 755 refs (a great number of tags),
the result is:

before: 22 ms
after: 3 ms

Using a list of 10000 elements also shows a factor of about 8.

Change-Id: Ide3f04ce4f13dd974c81e47f6f3c45abfaa15261
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: Fix "Open in Commit Viewer" from resource-filtered History view
message:
Fix "Open in Commit Viewer" from resource-filtered History view

When looking at the history of a single resource in the History view and
then opening a commit in the Commit Viewer, the Files section would show
invalid changes.

The problem was that the parent of the RevCommit was set to the previous
commit for the same resource and therefore the diff included all changes
between those commits (not only to the previous one).

We fix this by re-parsing the commit with a clean RevWalk before showing
it.

Change-Id: I24dbad00575e4c6b38da72c7b6ea6b90b30c5b33
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

message:

git_branch. The all work on the selected or named resource, i.e.

$|git_branch] would return the current branch in the (first)
selected project. $|git_branch:org.eclipse.jgit/.project] would
return the current branch of the main jgit repository in the
workbspace.

subject: Mark all .git dir's as ignored
message:
Mark all .git dir's as ignored

The Team Ignore extension point check given ignore pattern against file
name or whole workspace relative path. Sometimes we need to ignore files
like .git/index that won't math using old patter. In such cases new
patter needs to be added to match files inside .git folder.

The Team Ignore extension point will expand resource path into workspace
relative path when it finds '/' character in pattern. Such expanded path
will contain project name, therefore we need to add '*/.git/*' pattern
into ignored ones.

Bug: 334369
Change-Id: I12641c4d423960ca0e7d86c2cd867e0c93919622
Signed-off-by: Dariusz Luksza <dariusz@luksza.org>

subject: bug 347073 - clarify difference btw. remove and delete repository
message:
bug 347073 - clarify difference btw. remove and delete repository

The context menu of the repository view has the menu items "Remove
Repository" and "Delete Repository". "Remove Repository" removes a
repository from the repository view whereas "Delete Repository" deletes
a local [clone of a] repository from disk.

The difference btw. these two is not obvious enough. It was suggested to
adda tooltip to the context menu items but this appears not to be
technically possible. 

The patch proposes to rename the context menu item "Remove Repository"
to "Remove Repository from View".

subject: Fix remote tracking branch update on push
message:
Fix remote tracking branch update on push

Pushing via "Team->Push to upstream" and pushing via executing "Push" on
a remote's push node now updates the related remote tracking branch.
A third constructor was added to PushOperationUI to enable pushing on a
given remote name. The constructor of PushOperation was changed to take
the remote name instead of a remote config.
The new constructor in PushOperationUI was required because JGit's
PushCommand only updates the remote tracking branch if a remote name is
given. No update is performed if a push uri is provided.

Depends on JGit change
I2bc648abc517b1d01b2de15d383423ace2081e72

subject: [sync] Improve performance
message:
[sync] Improve performance

Adds thin cache that contains meta data (like changed object id's and
change type) from git. This cache is filled in background process just
before synchronization is launched and then it is used for quick
obtaining list of members for particular folder.

During my tests this implementation reduce time needed to compare linux
kernel source (version 2.6.38-rc2 against 2.6.36) in less then 1min
(usually 55s), when implementation from 1.0 needs 1m 40s.

Additionally some tests were updated.

This change requires also jgit change
I5a680a73e1cffa18ade3402cc86008f46c1da1f1

subject: Define a layout data for the warning composite
message:
Define a layout data for the warning composite

A composite in the history page was relying on a layout request to
have the layout data automatically generated and set onto the
composite. In the event that the composite's shell has been asked
to have its layout operations deferred, the layout data will not be
automatically generated or set, resulting in possible errors
farther down the code path when another method tries to ask the
composite in question for its layout data. The fix is to explicitly
set a layout data on the composite so that it doesn't have to rely
on a layout operation to have one.

message:
Fix wrong destination ref proposal in PushWizard

When the user entered "tags/myTag" into the source field the PushWizard
proposed "tags/myTag" in the destination field. This is then expanded to
"refs/tags/tags/myTag" by JGit. The analogous behavior was there if the
user entered heads/myBranch.

This commit fixes the bug; now the only the name after "tags/" resp.
"heads/" is proposed in the destination field.

subject: Do not downcast provided evaluation context as an EvaluationContext
message:
Do not downcast provided evaluation context as an EvaluationContext

The context that's passed into handlers are not guaranteed to be an
EvaluationContext so performing an instanceof check for that type
may potentially go nowhere. The fix is to use HandlerUtil's
getVariable(Object, String) method for retrieving variables from the
context. This lets the framework handle the processing of the
context instead of having EGit make arbitrary assumptions about the
type of the provided context.

Change-Id: I835f5629ba6e3b7853b2233e1ddb95453e01332f

subject: Use resource encoding in getFileCachedRevisionTypedElement
message:
Use resource encoding in getFileCachedRevisionTypedElement

This fixes problems in compare actions that use index as base (Compare
index with HEAD, Staging View and Synchronize View).

When the workspace encoding is different from the encoding of the
resource, the index side of the diff would be decoded incorrectly (while
the other side would be decoded correctly), leading to spurious diffs.

displays "Failed" when the status is not successful.

Also, the logic for rebase was inverted, leading to the image indicating
failure when the rebase was successful.

Depends on JGit change Icfc9a9c76763f8a777087a1262c8d6ad251a9068 for
isSuccessful.

message:

Having mnemonics defined for controls inside a part means that

the window's main menu bar. The 'History' view's controls should
not define mnemonics as they may conflict with any definitions
defined in the main menu bar.

subject: Suggest name when source ref is selected in new branch dialog
message:
Suggest name when source ref is selected in new branch dialog

If the branch name text is empty or has not been modified by the user,
suggest a branch name based on the selected source ref.

So when "refs/remotes/origin/stable-1.0" is selected, we pre-fill the
text with a suggestion of "stable-1.0", which is usually what is wanted
anyway.

Change-Id: I061d33dad289d93d6be41e1e902ed373168b1e2c
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: Diff node should notify listeners when the input changes
message:
Diff node should notify listeners when the input changes

The text merge viewers need to be notified when changes to a
compare input are saved. The text viewer can be notified of
changes from the diff node. Hence, when the compare input itself
has been notified that its been changed, this change event must
be forwarded to the diff node so that the text viewer can be
updated and reflect the differences of the newly changed compare
input. 

Bug: 352576
Change-Id: I2f83544f271fea4a4e21f346218a75ef67bae623

subject: Don't ask Compare to open two editors for selected IFiles
message:
Don't ask Compare to open two editors for selected IFiles

The 'Git Tree Compare' view had incorrect logic that caused two
editor open requests to be sent to Compare. This meant that when
the 'Reuse Compare Editor' option was selected, the editor would
get closed and when it wasn't selected, two compare editors
would get opened. Removing the first request and letting the
code cascade down to the request at the end of the method fixes
this problem.

Change-Id: I6b300a18e56af6059a34d751bb5c63abcb362c61

StagingView now cancels an already running reload job before scheduling
a new reload job. This avoids unnecessary expensive calculation of
IndexDiffs.
Furthermore the selected repository is not changed if the reload job was
canceled. This avoids showing incomplete staging information for the
newly selected repository.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Sawicki <kevin@github.com>

subject: [search] Prevent overly large repository area in dialog.
message:
[search] Prevent overly large repository area in dialog.

The search dialog table that shows the Git repositories was
grabbing an excess amount of space causing the dialog to open
larger than the screen height with no scrollbars on the table.
This was apparent if you had ~50 repositories configured in the
Git Repositories view.

This was due to the fact that the SearchDialog class sets the
layout data on the main control of the search page after it is
created which overrides the locally set data.

The fix prevents setting the layout data on the main control
after is had already been set by using a simple subclass of
Composite.

Change-Id: I3d60524054e92ef48f0102cb4d0c855d57162a86
Signed-off-by: Kevin Sawicki <kevin@github.com>

recently used branch names exist, more entries are added as
before this change.

This is only beginning of rewriting 'Git Change Set'. Next commits will

after synchronization.

subject: Change decorator to make use of IndexDiffCache
message:
Change decorator to make use of IndexDiffCache

To improve performance of the GitLightweightDecorator it was changed to
calculate decorations only based on cached IndexDiff results.

If resources are modified new decorations are shown almost immediately.
If the index changes (e.g. add operation) it takes for linux
kernel repo 20 sec. (vs. 35 sec. before) to propagate decorations.

in History View if the "Show all Branches and Tags" button was selected.
Normally this is not what the user expects.

With this commit the notes commits are not shown anymore per default.
Instead there is now a new action and a corresponding preference which
controls if the notes commits are shown

subject: [sync] Move partial change from HEAD to index
message:
[sync] Move partial change from HEAD to index

Allow replace partial change in staged file version with version from
HEAD. Such behavior is available for file versions in '<staged changes>'
node in 'Git Commits' model.

This change covers flowing use case: imagine situation that you staged
whole file where you changed two or more lines. The you would like to
replace one of those lines with version in HEAD.

As a side effect users can also move around changes when Compare editor
was launched from 'Compare With' > 'Git Index width HEAD'

message:
Fix clone via ssh with ssh keys and passphrase

The UserPasswordCredentialProvider doesn't support prompting for a
ssh private key passphrase. Hence use EGitCredentialsProvider
instead and enhance it to accept credentials provided upfront to using
the credentials provider.

The quick diff provider coming from EGit should only enable
itself if the resource in question is under a project that's
shared with Git through EGit. If it isn't, the provider needs to
be disabled as changes in the given resource has no Git history
to diff itself against.

message:
IndexDiffCache: recalculate IndexDiff if too many resources changed

Calculating an IndexDiff for a given list of files is more expensive
than calculating a complete IndexDiff if the number of files is big.
Now a complete IndexDiff is calculated if a big number of resources has
changed.
Furthermore tracing was improved.

IndexDiffCache now also listens to RefsChanged events.
This is required to get a notification when a commit occurs (commit does
not change the index).

subject: Enable 'Pull' operation when selecting multiple repositories
message:
Enable 'Pull' operation when selecting multiple repositories

The 'Pull' operation is already enabled when selecting multiple
projects spread across different repositories due to the work
of commit 4197370f. To enable this feature for the 'Git
Repositories' view, similar work must be done in the handler to
analyze that every single element in the selection corresponds
to a repository pointing at valid head reference. If this
criteria is satisfied, the 'Pull' operation should be enabled.

subject: Run Test Suite AllNonSWTTests in Maven Build
message:
Run Test Suite AllNonSWTTests in Maven Build

The test suite AllNonSWTTests was not part of the build.
To execute AllNonSWTTests a new test suite AllSWTAndNonSWTTests was
created that combines the suites AllLocalTests and AllNonSWTTests.
The Eclipse launch configuration "All-Non-SWT-Tests" was changed to run
outside the UI thread. This was done because the suite AllNonSWTTests
does not require the UI thread and does not run stable in the UI thread.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Sawicki <kevin@github.com>

subject: Decorate lightweight tags with checked out overlay.
message:
Decorate lightweight tags with checked out overlay.

Lightweight tags that point to the current detached HEAD commit
will now display the checked out overlay in the top right corner
similar to branches and annotated tags.

This also removes the 'L' overlay currently shown for lightweight
tags since it was displayed in the top right corner and would be
invisible when the checked out overlay was also drawn.

The 'L' looked abnormal when in tested in other corners so instead
a new icon was added for annotated tags and lightweight tags will
use the simple tag icon.

The new annotated tag icon is the standard tag icon with an
author overlay on the right side denoting that the tag has a
known tagger and message.

Bug: 357756

subject: Tighten activeWhen expression for the repository-based pull command
message:
Tighten activeWhen expression for the repository-based pull command

With open-ended expressions, handler conflicts may occur. Putting
stricter bounds into when a handler should be active will lessen the
chance of multiple handlers' activeWhen expressions clashing
together.

Bug: 359819
Change-Id: I7dd0c7e49083426cd3727b18e04e173fa58bf608

subject: IndexDiffCache: synchronize calculation with workspace changes
message:
IndexDiffCache: synchronize calculation with workspace changes

The index diff calculation jobs now wait for the workspace lock before
calculation of an index diff starts. This avoids starting calculation of
an index diff while the workspace changes (e.g. due to a branch
operation). The index diff calculation jobs do not lock the workspace
during execution to avoid blocking the workspace.

Change-Id: I7ada16fdcf278fdeabb039a14e21c0742793f2b9
Signed-off-by: Jens Baumgart <jens.baumgart@sap.com>

subject: IndexDiffCache: reload job should not fail in case of errors
message:
IndexDiffCache: reload job should not fail in case of errors

The calculation of an IndexDiff in a reload job can fail if the
workspace / repository changes concurrently. In case of a failure the
exception is caught and a recalculation of the index diff is scheduled.

Change-Id: I9d18aea517c5a95a7e37a19681f029996b781847
Signed-off-by: Jens Baumgart <jens.baumgart@sap.com>

subject: IndexDiffCacheEntry: improve check for ignored resources
message:
IndexDiffCacheEntry: improve check for ignored resources

The resource change listener checked too late for ignored resources.
This resulted in the problem that e.g. a derived bin folder was visited.

Change-Id: Iaf01b22a3d49d99f28df291e0727363554c24153
Signed-off-by: Jens Baumgart <jens.baumgart@sap.com>

subject: Implement DiscardChangesOperation in an efficient way
message:
Implement DiscardChangesOperation in an efficient way

DiscardChangesOperation was very slow because it executed one
CheckoutCommand per resource. Now it executes one CheckoutCommand per
repository.

Bug: 360133
Change-Id: Ic816a05b81708b9938410c61ca7e8a4495753024
Signed-off-by: Jens Baumgart <jens.baumgart@sap.com>

message:

An NPE occurred in IndexDiffData because IndexDiffCacheEntry tried to
update the indexDiffData member which was null (not yet calculated).

Change-Id: I0c9e2008424609229fc781e6304062044d37a1e3
Signed-off-by: Jens Baumgart <jens.baumgart@sap.com>

subject: Ensure all parent commits have a parsed body.
message:
Ensure all parent commits have a parsed body.

Parsed parent commits are needed by the compare with
actions that were currently failing when the commit editor
was invoked from the pull/fetch/push result dialogs.

Bug: 360956

these buttons were used.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Sawicki <kevin@github.com>

subject: Enforce the use of Java5 API:s only (with a few exceptions)
message:
Enforce the use of Java5 API:s only (with a few exceptions)

This only works with Eclipse 3.6 and newer and requires installation
of new package. Documentation is not very good, but there is a blog
about it here: http://eclipseandjazz.blogspot.com/2011/10/of-invalid-references-to-system.html

API checking is especially useful on OS X where Java5 is not readily
available.

Change-Id: I574e8c8b2e1b4cad2675b482268cdc98b35da38a

subject: Ignore null returns for getAdapter(Class)
message:
Ignore null returns for getAdapter(Class)

When an element is retrieved from the selection service,
getAdapter(IProject.class) is invoked on it to determine if the
selection can be adapted to become a project. If that cannot be
satisfied, the code should be allowed to proceed normally and
treat the object as it is in the event that the currently
selected object is of a type that supports the switching of
branches.

Bug: 361556
Change-Id: Iee98076ae1bfc050263537decc1ce442448cc26d

subject: SpellcheckableMessageArea: remove platform specific line endings
message:
SpellcheckableMessageArea: remove platform specific line endings

SpellcheckableMessageArea.getCommitMessage called
getTextWidget().getLineDelimiter() to determine the platform line
ending. This was wrong because getLineDelimiter() returns the first
line delimiter found in the text control.
The new implementation of SpellcheckableMessageArea.getCommitMessage
guarantees that the returned string only contains \n line endings.

Change-Id: If1dbab98745d3178163bad4a66ca3f1a15f5b456
Signed-off-by: Jens Baumgart <jens.baumgart@sap.com>

message:
StagingView: fix error in selection handling

Staging View did not react on a selected repository in Repositories View
because it tried to adapt the selected object to IResource before

subject: Fix ignoring of files to be ignored in working tree root
message:

the ignore rules defined outside the working tree (exclude file,
ignore rules defined in home directory, system wide ignore rules).

message:

If a synchronization operation is only asking a specific set of
resources to be updated, only that particular set of resources
should be filtered out for an update of the synchronization
cache. This removes the need to walk the entire tree when the
user has only made changes to a small number of resources.

refs/notes/review:refs/notes/review. Since it is standard git behavior
to expect a ref on the remote if there is no wildcard in the refspec we
do not add this refspec in this case.

subject: Allow the user to select the Git prefix
message:
Allow the user to select the Git prefix

The Git prefix is the location of the user's C Git installation. EGit
does not use C Git, but want to see its system wide configuration.

This mainly affects Windows users, since Git for Windows overrides
defaults in $git_prefix/etc/gitconfig. Additionally many Windows users
do not add Git to PATH, so automatically determining the location often
does not work on Windows.

The overridden Git prefix is stored in the workspace

subject: Handle excluded resources properly in 'Git Staging' view
message:
Handle excluded resources properly in 'Git Staging' view

As the 'Git Staging' view is intended to be a mirror of the 'git
status' command in the command line, it should use the standard
FileTreeIterator from JGit for walking over the working
directory and index. Using EGit APIs that interact with
Eclipse's resources layer will not work correctly because
IContainer's members(*) method will not return excluded
resources. As the command line does not consider excluded
resources any differently from regular files, the 'Git Staging'
view should follow the same guideline and not deviate in its
behaviour and display of information.

Bug: 362319
Change-Id: Id875f858a5fa3feff3846ea368ae07e76a004d11
Signed-off-by: Remy Suen <remysuen@ca.ibm.com>

subject: Do not set a filter if an empty string is present
message:
Do not set a filter if an empty string is present

As the compare editor input uses the input resources for
determining what it should filter to show, its filter may
potentially be an empty string if the project is both the parent
of the .git folder as well as the selected root resource for the
compare editor to display. If this scenario is satisfied, simply
skip the discovered empty string and don't bother setting a
filter on the walk.

Bug: 359308
Change-Id: Ib303ff689b6a7a70f5aa4ba6fa986a94f7997f87
Signed-off-by: Remy Suen <remysuen@ca.ibm.com>

subject: [sync] Simplify operations on change actions
message:
[sync] Simplify operations on change actions

Simplify operations when repository changed occurs. Also use
IndexDiffChangedListener for retrieving information about changed
resource (in this case break point add/remove events are not
propagated).

Bug: 358898
Change-Id: I6ae88da36dffaa913dc37525aec5ad8dca240fe0
Signed-off-by: Dariusz Luksza <dariusz@luksza.org>

subject: Do not create a filter for empty string paths
message:
Do not create a filter for empty string paths

When the merge compare editor input is created, it uses the
resources selected by the user to determine what the tree
structure of compared resources should be. If a selected project
is both the parent of the .git folder as well as the selected
root resource to perform the merge for, an empty string will be
determined as the filter to use for generating the differences.
In this case, a path filter should not be created for the empty
string as it is unnecessary as this would be identical to simply
iterating over all of the files in the repository.

Change-Id: I92ea4d4fa95edd8d9b2fef7a820cc0adacb520c7

subject: Pass file encoding to EditableRevision in FileEditableRevision
message:
Pass file encoding to EditableRevision in FileEditableRevision

Previously, the encoding was not specified. This could lead to spurious
diffs when the default workspace encoding is different from the file
encoding (e.g. for XML files), because the left and right sides were
decoded differently. An example of where this occurred was the Merge
Tool with the HEAD version as left input.

This this change, the problem-causing constructor of EditableRevision
without encoding argument can be deleted, as this was the last code
using it.

subject: [RFC] Show detailed branch status in label decoration of project
message:
[RFC] Show detailed branch status in label decoration of project

The branch status is shown after the branch name in the decoration if
the current branch is different from the remote tracking branch. This is
useful as a visual indication that the branch needs to be pushed (or
merged/rebased).

If there are commits on the branch that are not on the tracking branch,
an upwards arrow (↑) followed by the number of commits is shown. This
can be read as "the branch is N commits ahead" or "N commits need to be
pushed".

If there are commits on the tracking branch that are not on the local
branch, a downwards arrow (↓) is shown, followed by the number of
commits. This can be read as "the branch is N commits behind" or "N
commits need to be merged".

For example, if there are 2 unpushed commits on master, the project is
now shown like this:

  project [repo master ↑2]

If there are both unpushed and unmerged commits (the branches have
diverged), it's shown like this:

  project [repo master ↑2 ↓1]

In C Git, information about the tracking branch is displayed in "git
status" output. EGit currently doesn't have any indication that a branch
needs to be pushed, apart from the labels in History View. When there
are multiple repositories involved, it can easily happen that a push is
forgotten. This change helps prevent that.

Change-Id: I1e1caca561d1b0a0c194bfc42e64b698f42c6e6a
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: [RFC] [historyView] Remove status messages
message:
[RFC] [historyView] Remove status messages

The history view current displays a status message and hides
the commit graph table when loading or showing no input.  This
produces a flickering when switching between repositories or
when in link with selection mode.

Now the history view keeps the current table input while loading
the new input in the background and shows an empty table when
no commits are found to display.

The status message during loading did not seem necessary since
the job is present in the Progress view with information about
what is being loaded.  Also an empty table seems sufficient to
let the user know there are no commits to display

Also no longer join the cancel job since it can hang the UI-thread.

This change is not intended for a 1.2 release.

since it uses org.eclipse.team.core.ScmUrlImportDescription
and org.eclipse.team.core.ProjectSetCapability.SCHEME_SCM
which are only available in team framework starting with 3.6. Copy them
to fix the build until we drop support for Galileo.

subject: Provide proper scheduling rules for operations locking the Git index
message:
Provide proper scheduling rules for operations locking the Git index

Currently the AddToIndexOperation provides the input resources as
scheduling rule. This is wrong because this suggests that two Add To
Index Jobs can run in parallel if the input resources are not
conflicting and belong to the same Git repository.
Now a scheduling rule is used that locks all projects of a given
repository to prevent Jobs running in parallel that modify the index
of the same repository.
The scheduling rules of other EGit operations modifying the Git index
were changed accordingly.

Bug: 366684
Change-Id: I5a6d420035d086cedb51a69041e571c178f3dbc8
Signed-off-by: Jens Baumgart <jens.baumgart@sap.com>

subject: Improve abysmal performance of commit info update in history view
message:
Improve abysmal performance of commit info update in history view

When the number of branches is large, the large amounts of
RevWalk.isMerge translates a gross a amount calls to
MergeBaseGenerator.carryOntoOne with deep stacks. For 8200 branches,
e.g. if you fetch refs/changes/* from Gerrit, this translates
to 50 million calls to carryOntoOne.

In real that is ~3.3 seconds for a repo with the large number
of refs and .06 for a normal clone.

Take a simpler approach and scan every branch until we find the
selected commit or one of it's parents. After this fix info update
with the large refs set is about .5 seconds. For normal clones
there is no difference.

Furthe improvve by using the heuristic that says commit times should
be increasing for each new commit and therefore do not examine branches
whose tip commit is older than the commit we are lookig at. Allow for
a clock skew of 24 hours. After this getBranches() is down to 0.35
seconds.

Change-Id: I6de60760f1644b4e968c7b0caeffcc0007b2da33

subject: Limit the listing of the branches that a commit appear on to 20

Now the '.project' file is passed to the ProjectRecord constructor
when restoring projects on a checked out branch.

was not tracked since they didn't have a relative path and
were not stored correctly in the memento.

This case is now explicitly handled and a project at the root
of the repository's working directory will now be tracked and
re-opened when switching branches.

subject: Fix the behavior of the Share|Git... dialog when a repo is a symlink link
message:
Fix the behavior of the Share|Git... dialog when a repo is a symlink link

The RepositoryFinder.register(IContainer, File) method is capable of
regsitering a repository with a path that is not relative to the containing
project, because of the nature of File.getCanonicalFile().  For instance,
if you are working in /dev/workspace/project and that path contains a .git
symlink which points to /dev/repo/project.git, then the registered path for
that repository will be the latter.  However, code in RepositoringMapping.
getGitDirAbsolutePath() and ExistingOrNewPage.fillTreeItemWithGitDirectory()
make assumptions about it being relative to the containing project.

This only occurs in Linux because File.getCanonicalFile() does not have the
same behavior on Windows.  Specifically it doesn't recognize junctions (the
Windows equivalent to symbolic links) and therefore does not try to resolve
them.

This patch addresses the problem by removing the use of
File.getCanonicalFile() and replacing it with File.getAbsoluteFile() which
is already there as a fallback if File.getCanonicalFile() throws an
exception.  This will make the behavior of sharing a project the same on
both Windows and Linux.

subject: Fix diff icons and left/right sides in History View compare
message:
Fix diff icons and left/right sides in History View compare

When comparing two commits via "Compare with Each Other" in History
View, there were two problems:

1. For CHANGE cases, the commit ID label and the actual content of the
   sides did not match. This is fixed by always showing compareRev on
   the left, consistent with setLeftLabel and setRightLabel earlier in
   the code.

2. For ADDITION/DELETION cases, the icon shown in the tree was reversed.
   For an addition (file doesn't exist in base/right, exists in
   compare/left), a [-] was shown (weird). By ORing it with
   Differencer.RIGHT, we get a nice left to right arrow with a +/- in it
   (which is then correct).

message:
[historyView] Track renamed paths and provide to actions

Several History view actions currently fail when the view is
set to follow renames since they derive the path used from
the current repository path and do not take into account
older paths that the resource was known as.

This commit creates a simple RenameTracker class that tracks
which commits introduced renames allowing the GitHistoryPage
to provide the previous paths for a specific commit given the
initial path.

subject: Close Synchronize View after each synchronize test
message:
Close Synchronize View after each synchronize test

We frequently observe failing synchronize tests timing out when looking
for some widget, typically re-running the failed test separately without
repeating all the tests in the test suite succeeds. Closing the
synchronize view between tests seems to reduce the chance of
interferences between synchronize tests when they are all run in one
test run.

checkout of branches based on the active task.

subject: Fix releasing RevWalks in GitHistoryPage
message:
Fix releasing RevWalks in GitHistoryPage

When a new History rendering was triggered a RevWalk is created. This
RevWalk was released when the next history rendering was triggered. 
However, at this point in time the RevWalk may still have been used by
the previous GenerateHistoryJob in another thread. This leads to NPEs.

Now we release the RevWalk when the GenerateHistoryJob is done.

Change-Id: I3685bd6994952b1378bbd14f39245d2edf64ee15
Signed-off-by: Christian Halstrick <christian.halstrick@sap.com>

It previously only existed for the commit dialog. This change extracts
some code to share it with the staging view and makes it available
there.

Change-Id: I2e2c6e737167650127f87f94aa4fa39fb8fa3db0
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: [historyView] Do not store the RevWalk as a field in GitHistoryPage
message:
[historyView] Do not store the RevWalk as a field in GitHistoryPage

When the history is redrawn a new RevWalk is created and configured
corresponding to the settings of the history view. This RevWalk is used
in the scheduled GenerateHistoryJob.

The RevWalk was stored in a field in the GitHistoryPage, although it is
not a property of such a Page. This can potentially lead to problem, and
indeed it caused bug 374675 which was fixed by
3604b5cd5fbf6ac354bc2a247115df7eade81959.

By passing it as a parameter the scope of the RevWalk instance is made
clearer.

Change-Id: I340f2a3cc7340dec781c09b8b8ced6a3fb03bdc5
Signed-off-by: Stefan Lay <stefan.lay@sap.com>

the decoration of untracked folders.

Also change the asserts to show more information on failure.

message:
Load branches, tags, and diffs on background thread

Previously the CommitEditorPage loads all data displayed
on the UI thread which would cause temporary freezes for
branches with many tags/branches or commits that changed
many files.

Now all loading is done in a background job with only the
author, committer, parent, and message displaying initially.

Previously IndexDiffCacheEntry would go into a non-stop
scheduling loop if calculating the IndexDiff raised
any RuntimeException or IOException.

This change now only catches the IOException thrown by
IndexDiff and does not reschedule when this exception
occurs.

message:

subject: Fix infinite loop on branch deletion
message:
Fix infinite loop on branch deletion

This change fixes several issues in the branch deletion action of
repositories view:

1. Branch deletion was done in the UI thread. Execution is done in
ModalContext thread now.
2. Branch deletion executed multiple workspace runnables. A top level
workspace runnable is added to provide atomicity and to avoid multiple
change broadcasting.
3. RepositoryPropertySourceProvider performed a syncExec in its config
change listener which caused the loop.

allows the user to share a project without doing any explicit

message:

Move the Id column from position 3 to position 0 and
show the SHA-1 abbreviated to 7 characters.

Set the minimum width of the first column to show the
entire abbreviated id text.

This should make it easier to give the author/committer
and date columns the remaining space after the message
column but still be able to see the SHA-1 without being
the focus of the content displayed.

subject: Warn when amending a commit already on a remote tracking branch
message:
Warn when amending a commit already on a remote tracking branch

It sometimes happens that a user amends a commit that is already pushed.
This leads to a rejected push when the user tries to push the next time.
It happens either by accident or when the user doesn't yet know about
how to use amend.

To avoid this, a warning text is now shown when the user presses amend.
It's only shown when the commit to amend is contained in any remote
tracking branch (which means the commit is no longer just local).

In the commit dialog, the warning is shown as a dialog message, the same
way the existing warnings already are.

In the staging view, a label above the commit message editor is shown
when there is a warning. It's not only used for the amend warning, but
also warnings about author and committer text, the same way as in the
commit dialog.

Bug: 379172
Change-Id: If79d3459e9d6db3e1179489ebe3b206e4f5ae6eb
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

message:

Check in EclipseSshSessionFactory does user have properly configured SSH
keys, if not throw exception with suitable message.

subject: Do not run tests using maven-surefire-plugin in OSGi environment
message:
Do not run tests using maven-surefire-plugin in OSGi environment

Running plain junit tests in an OSGi environment using
maven-surefire-plugin isn't guaranteed to work as split packages can
lead to signing errors when the maven-surefire-plugin loads classes not
respecting OSGi class loading rules. Hence run the few plain junit
tests as part of the swtbot tests which are run on top of Eclipse
platform's OSGi runtime.

Change-Id: Ib94f947e639d149d57b676d50a1302ea5517bb78

message:
Remove content length checking from AddOperationTest

With JGit updates to correct how smudged index entries
are handled these tests were currently failing.

Remove the explicit length checkking from AddOperationTest
but still verify added entries are present in the index.

Length checking is not necessary here since files being in
the index after the operation completes is what is being
validated.

File length checking is done in lower level JGit unit tests.

subject: Define target platforms for the build
message:
Define target platforms for the build

This simplifies setting up the Eclipse workspace and allows to use
Eclipse versions for development which are not matching the target
platform version. In order to set a target platform open it using the
target editor and click "Set as Target Platform". The EGit Maven build
now also is based on the same target platform definition. This way
dependencies used in the Maven build are identical to those used in
Eclipse.

This change is a prerequisite for change
Id9d721ae574a83ad9440a93ddb143b1271fc2b2b as this is using a feature of
the team framework only available in Juno. Without a target platform
definition this could not be built in older Eclipse versions.

Change-Id: I462e4a35fea4caec7ae95b08ac13cb495c0fa309

MANIFEST.MF. To give it a try, open Plug-ins view, select a plug-in,
right click and Import As > Project from a Repository.... Then follow
instructions in the wizard. Importing with a tag is not supported yet,
see bug 367712.

This allows EGit compilation against all supported eclipse platform
versions but only builds the p2 repository when built against Juno.
This should be improved in a subsequent change.

subject: RFC Git API does not declare GitAPIException call()
message:
RFC Git API does not declare GitAPIException call()

Anyone that calls a Git API should catch GitAPIException and not just
the currently known exceptions.

During the process of cleaning this up a number of cases, but not all
cases where only checked exceptions were called into catching all
Exceptions except Error.

This changes adapt EGit to changes made in JGit for this reason.

With this change, the branch selection dialog will come up offering to

confusing (there is no point to select a specific column in the table)

subject: Load history incrementally
message:
Load history incrementally

Loading history incrementally can drastically reduce memory consumption
and the time needed to render the part of the history the user is
interested in. Most often only the most recent part of the history is
needed. Hence load only one batch of 256 commits initially and keep the
GenerateHistoryJob in order to incrementally load the next batch when
the user has scrolled down half of the loading batch size (128 commits).

JGit-Dependency: Id3b97d88d3b4b2d67561b11f8810cb88fe040823
Change-Id: Ibc88d589ea2a5f233cd65c203bde9187c122a277
Signed-off-by: Matthias Sohn <matthias.sohn@sap.com>
Signed-off-by: Stefan Lay <stefan.lay@sap.com>

subject: [historyView] Load commit body lazily
message:
[historyView] Load commit body lazily

The body of loaded objects is now thrown away in the walker after it has
parsed the information necessary to render the history graph. It is
reloaded when content of the body is needed in the HistoryView.

For large repositories this saves a lot of memory, e.g. about 110 MB for
linux kernel.

JGit-Dependency: I9291ba8c34c8744bc009b1bd302ed28bfa4e9476
Change-Id: I1504a6127e7fc2ebea67baade5e9799b256ab116

subject: Use correct path when comparing with previous revision
message:
Use correct path when comparing with previous revision

Previously a RenameCallback was registered on the FollowFilter
to find the previous path of the file being compared.  This
led to incorrect behavior since the callback fires for all
renames, not just for the commits processed through directly
calling RevWalk.next().

Now a RenameDetector is directly used after computing the
diffs between the head commit and the previous commit.
The path is only updated if the rename detector detects
that the current path was renamed between the two commits.

Change-Id: I562b7b3d0d96f6ce7294a9e2c84d9bb292ae6cf4

subject: Allow amending a published commit
message:
Allow amending a published commit

Provide a message type from CommitMessageComponent so
calling classes know the severity of the message and
report amending a published commit as a warning.

subject: [historyView] Perform clear on background thread when disposed
message:
[historyView] Perform clear on background thread when disposed

An NPE can occur if SWTCommitList.clear() is called
from dispose() while fillTo() is running from
GenerateHistoryJob.

dispose() is always called on the UI-thread so schedule
a background thread that synchronizes on the instance
and calls clear since all other state accessing calls to
the SWTCommitList instance are done inside synchronized
blocks.

Change-Id: I855d5bfeb5131c634b4790e6b7231424f2be4566

commit.

subject: [stagingView] Don't show other warnings when commit is not allowed
message:
[stagingView] Don't show other warnings when commit is not allowed

If a commit is not allowed (e.g. in conflicts state), the author and
committer text fields are set to empty. This lead to the status of the
commit message component to be not OK, and a warning was shown: "Invalid
committer specified".

Instead of the warning about the committer, we now show the message why
committing is not allowed at the moment. This message can be further
improved later to help the user, e.g. "Please resolve conflicts and then
commit".

subject: Warn user if Git's system wide settings cannot be found
message:
Warn user if Git's system wide settings cannot be found

A Git user may have important settings in the system wide configuration
file. That file is located relative to Git's installation directory.
Egit
tries to find that file automatically by looking for the git executable.
If Git cannot be found then EGit also cannot find the system wide
settings.

In order to stay compatible with Git, in particulary on Windows, where
Git
may not appear in %PATH%, it is important that the user gets notified
that
there may be a problem. The most important setting is typically
core.autocrlf.

Change-Id: Id1b6261edb778e82d76c0dfcfbf26228aa515ee9

subject: IndexDiffCacheEntry: wait for workspace lock using begin/end rule
message:
IndexDiffCacheEntry: wait for workspace lock using begin/end rule

IndexDiffCacheEntry.waitForWorkspaceLock is used to synchronize
IndexDiff calculations with workspace changes. IndexDiff calculation is
started when the workspace can be locked.
The old implementation performed an empty Workspace.run to achieve this.
This could result in the state that Workspace.run acquires scheduling
rule workspace root and waits for OrderedLock because another thread is
broadcasting changes.
To avoid this blocking of workspace root waitForWorkspaceLock now avoids
calling Workspace.run. Instead JobManager().beginRule is used to wait.

The old name is pretty generic and confuses people, resulting in "EGit

personally. They were checking all EGit features and were confused when
the installation did not complete, e.g. on Eclipse 3.7.

clear that this is an optional feature that is not needed by non-PDE
users.

subject: [stagingView] Add Delete action for untracked files
message:

If the selection only includes workspace resources, the normal
DeleteResourceAction is used. Because of this, the delete can even be
undone. This change also makes the undo and redo menu items available
when the staging view is focused for this to be discoverable.

If the selection includes a non-workspace resource, the action is
carried out by a new DeleteResourcesOperation, which can handle
non-workspace resources. This has no undo support though.

The new operation can later also be used for offering Delete for Working
Directory files in the Repositories view.

subject: Show problem decorations in staging view and commit dialog
message:
Show problem decorations in staging view and commit dialog

This makes errors/warnings on the files visible while committing.
Before, these could only be noticed in other places before committing
(e.g. the package explorer).

In an early draft of this change, the decoration was done directly in
StagingViewLabelProvider (without using IDecoratorManager). The problem
with that approach was that the decorations didn't get updated after
editing a file.

With the extension point and IDecoratorManager, updating the decoration
works. And, except for having to exclude GitLightweightDecorator via
IDecorationContext, it feels cleaner.

subject: Allow empty commit in the case of a merge commit
message:
Allow empty commit in the case of a merge commit

It sometimes happens that a resolved merge/cherry-pick is the same as
HEAD, in which case no files are staged for commit.

Before this change, the user was stuck in this state as the staging view
and commit dialog both refused to do a commit without staged files.

With this change, an empty commit is now allowed when the repository
state is MERGING_RESOLVED or CHERRY_PICKING_RESOLVED.

subject: [historyView] Rebase: Pass a better Ref as upstream
message:
[historyView] Rebase: Pass a better Ref as upstream

JGit change I1333a8dd170bb0077f491962013485efb6f2a926 is about improving
the ours/theirs conflict markers during rebase. The way the rebase
action worked before, it would always pass the commit ID to rebase,
which is not very helpful during a rebase conflict.

This change makes it use a Ref if there is one. If there are multiple
refs pointing to the selected commit:

- and if the branch being rebased tracks another one, this tracked
  branch should be the one to pick if it's in the list
- otherwise pick a remote tracking branch if it's in the list

Also adds a "does it work at all?" test for rebase in History view.

Bug: 343072

subject: Improve hard wrapping by joining the line after a wrapped line
message:
Improve hard wrapping by joining the line after a wrapped line

This extends the hard wrapping of the commit message in the Staging View
and Commit Dialog.

With the previous behavior, if one had a finished line/paragraph and
added text at the front, the text at the end would get
wrapped
like
this.

That made manual re-wrapping necessary. In the case of a paragraph,
several lines had to be edited again.

This change improves that use case by turning the line delimiter after a
wrapped word into a space to join the lines. It takes care not to join
empty lines or lines which start with a symbol (e.g. a bullet list).

It also gets rid of flickering during wrapping by only redrawing after
having applied all edits.

subject: RepositoryMapping: Don't work with "non-workspace" IResource
message:
RepositoryMapping: Don't work with "non-workspace" IResource

The implementations of getMappingForNonWorkspaceResource() and
getRepoRelativePath() in RepositoryMapping were confusing workspace
paths with filesystem locations. On certain platforms, they may actually
be the same, but e.g. on Windows this is never the case and leads to all
kinds of problems.

The problem is that IResource#getFullPath() returns e.g. /foo/bar (where
/ means workspace root), whereas IResource#getLocation() returns the
absolute file system path. This caused later code which treated the
paths as absolute file system paths to return incorrect results.

Instead of incorrectly using an IResource for non-workspace files, we
now work with IPath if necessary, e.g. for comparing with index from
Staging View.

subject: Ensure consistent ignore handling compared to cgit
message:
Ensure consistent ignore handling compared to cgit

EGit considers derived resources as if they were mentioned in
.gitignore. This looks like a nice Eclipse integration on first sight,
but it causes trouble when git is used on the command line (since
derived resources are not ignored there). This might also break
consistency when some developers use a different type of IDE or editor
which doesn't share Eclipse's opinion about which Resources are derived.
Fix this by no longer considering this hint provided by the Team
framework.

subject: Git Tree Compare: Unify workbench and PathNode tree code
message:
Git Tree Compare: Unify workbench and PathNode tree code

WorkbenchTreeContentProvider had a serious problem in that it only
descended into folders which existed in the workspace. The reason for
that was that it used getChildren of its base class
WorkbenchContentProvider.

For example, when the base (workspace) version had these files:

  a
  b/1

And compare version had these:

  a
  b/1
  c/1

The "c/1" file should be shown as "deleted" in the view. The problem was
that the "c" folder was not contained in the workspace and so the
content provider never included "c/1". It did include deleted files
whose parent folder was known, but not others.

This could maybe have been fixed by introducing artificial folder nodes
(implementing IWorkbenchAdapter) in such a situation (but only for the
special case above).

Instead, this change unifies the workbench with the PathNode content
provider code. Care was taken to keep the appearance by using
WorkbenchLabelProvider for container nodes and continuing to work with
IFile where possible. The tree construction was also simplified.

subject: Fix RevisionSyntaxException in the Push wizard
message:
Fix RevisionSyntaxException in the Push wizard

The refspec panel passed strings like "master [branch]" to the revision
parser. The revision parser used to allow garbage after the revision,
but was tightened, which then triggered this bug.

Instead of working with the content proposal label, add a method to get
the corresponding content. Then use this when working with ref specs.

Also just overwrite the combo text when it changes, otherwise the nice
label like "master [branch]" is replaced by "refs/heads/master", even
though it would not have been necessary.

Another unhandled RevisionSyntaxException was in tryResolveLocalRef,
e.g. when calling completion with "refs/".

for MODIFIED files. Showing both is redundant and can confuse newcomers.

Therefore remove the replace with index action, as the other is easier

subject: [sync] Update tracking branch when pushing
message:
[sync] Update tracking branch when pushing

Pushing a branch to a remote for which there is a tracking branch should
update the tracking branch. This was not the case when using the "Push"
action in the Synchronize view.

The solution involves two parts. First, PushOperation did not consider
fetch refspecs while calculating RemoteRefUpdates. Changing that caused
the RemoteRefUpdates to correctly include a TrackingRefUpdate.

Second, PushOperationUI used to take the passed RemoteRefUpdates and
then create RefSpecs for passing to the PushCommand. In this conversion,
tracking ref updates are lost. By using the transport API we can
directly pass the RemoteRefUpdates.

Another solution would have been to pass the remote name to the
PushCommand instead of a bare URIsh, but that would have involved
changing PushOperationSpecification (which only uses URIish).

Bug: 317411
Change-Id: I0e43f8b4e0b525a5cf35de9fdc135e2e539d03b6

subject: Make RemoveFromIndexOperation work for multiple repositories
message:
Make RemoveFromIndexOperation work for multiple repositories

RemoveFromIndexActionHandler is enabled when resources from different
repositories are selected. But before this change it would not actually
work because it passed the repository to the operation and the operation
would use that to calculate the paths.

Change-Id: I26c3a84aa8e874d74fe863428cb737031757b372

subject: Support filtered resources in ContainerTreeIterator
message:
Support filtered resources in ContainerTreeIterator

Filtered resources are useful when working with nested projects, like
this:

  root/
    .project
    sub/
      .project

In the above configuration, the root project typically contains resource
filters so that "sub" is not shown as a subdirectory of root in
navigator views but can be imported as a separate project.

When resources are filtered, they are not returned from API like
IContainer#members. So ContainerTreeIterator needs to check if resource
filters are configured and if that's the case, list additional
files/folders through the Java File API. It then falls back to
AdaptableFileTreeIterator for subtrees.

This depends on small changes in JGit's FileTreeIterator, see below.

Bug: 358901
Change-Id: I2c41d86b8b74c2a334433de1bbfed5b36af872bf
JGit-Dependency: Ie0f9c9434ef7d73a8d73d4fe46db4147ded1d267

message:
Fix NPE in IndexDiffCacheEntry.calcIndexDiffData (incremental)

When an incremental refresh is done before any full refresh,
indexDiffData is null, which could lead to an NPE. So do a full refresh
instead when no prior indexDiffData is available.

This can happen because full reload jobs cancel each other, whereas an
incremental reload job is never cancelled. Whether this is desired
should be investigated separately.

This change also renames the methods for more clarity.

subject: Show untracked files if required by preferences
message:
Show untracked files if required by preferences

The "show untracked" dialog setting in the commit dialog is not
synchronized with the "include untracked" preference option. This is
wrong because both are related. If the preference setting is true then
untracked files are checked but they may not be visible in the commit
dialog. 

This commits links the enabled states together. As a result, when
the preference is set to true, the action "show untracked" will always
be enabled when the commit dialog pops up.

subject: Make Synchronize view UI tests stable
message:
Make Synchronize view UI tests stable

There were a few things contributing to the instability:

- The test setup was only done once in @BeforeClass and then "cleaned
  up" by doing a reset twice and waiting. Setup is now done in @Before
  and a complete cleanup is done in @After, so that test execution order
  does not affect the outcome.

- Switching between "Git Commits" and "Workspace" models was done by
  clicking on the drop down in the Synchronize view toolbar, which is
  very fragile. The desired model is now enabled via team API once for
  each test class.

With this, 2 tests no longer need to be ignored and all tests succeed
reliably on my machine.

subject: Only return existing IFile from getFileForLocation
message:
Only return existing IFile from getFileForLocation

In a nested project layout, e.g.:

  root/
    .project
    sub/
      .project
      a.txt

"sub" is not necessarily excluded from root with resource filters.

So when calling ResourceUtil.getFileForLocation for a.txt,
IWorkspaceRoot#getFileForLocation (before this change) would return an
IFile belonging to the root project, even when it was closed. When the
project is closed, IFile returns false from exists() and later results
in the RepositoryMapping not being found.

One way to fix this would be to only return the IFile if it exists(),
and return null otherwise.

But in the above case, we can return an IFile that exists, from the sub
project. To find this, we call findFilesForLocationURI and then return
the first file which exists.

This fixes the reported problem while also including linked resources,
which is desired in the future.

subject: Lessen the re-indexing work and number of queued jobs
message:
Lessen the re-indexing work and number of queued jobs

Do not queue jobs unnecessarily and eliminate some unneeded jobs. As it
turns out, this is mostly a cosmetic problem.

The jobs have a potentially long initialization where they just lessen
the risk of executing in parallel with other heavy jobs. During this
period we may still cancel previous jobs just to queue a new one,
getting a huge queue of jobs. For the full re-indexing jobs, we can just
ignore re-indexing since the first one will do all necessary work.

Also acknowledge the fact the full re-indexing job does all work that an
incremental indexing job does and therefore we can skip launching an
incremental indexing job if a full reindexing operation is imminent (in
locking phase).

Change-Id: I22f3d831a085bb6a9b2fdce79e17996b7f6f6761

subject: [sync] Fix performance problem with GitModelCache#getChildren
message:
[sync] Fix performance problem with GitModelCache#getChildren

The problem was that it returned a child for each changed file, instead
of only the direct children. So e.g. with changes in "dir/a", "dir/b"
and "dir/c", it returned a node for "dir" three times. When the number
of changes is significant, this resulted in many children returned, each
of which also has children which will be processed by the calling code.

The code in GitModelCommit for tree construction did it right. To fix
this, this change consolidates the two tree construction implementations
into one which should be correct.

It also takes care that the final tree nodes use as little memory as
possible by using arrays.

subject: Fix rebase pulldown in toolbar not being accessible during rebase
message:
Fix rebase pulldown in toolbar not being accessible during rebase

During rebase, the rebase pulldown menu in the toolbar was always
disabled, resulting in no way to do a "abort" or other actions through
the toolbar.

The problem is that the enabled state of the action handler for the main
action also determines whether the pulldown menu can be opened (the
little arrow besides the icon). So instead of disabling it when rebase
is not possible, also enable it during rebase, and check state again
when executing.

subject: Fix for RepositoryMapping returning wrong mapping.
message:
Fix for RepositoryMapping returning wrong mapping.

The logic in getMapping did not cover the case properly when a path was
totally outside a repository mapping. For example, when workingTree is
"C:\my\working\tree" and the path in question is "D:\a\cloned\repo"
path.makeRelativ(workingTree) would return path "D:\a\cloned\repo". As a
result, the if clause is true and the mapping is returned although the
working tree from the mapping is completely unrelated to the path.

A better (and simpler) way is to simply use workingTree.isPrefixOf(path)
for the check. This properly determines if a path is within a working
tree.

The commit also adds a test for detecting the situation.

Bug: 403008
Change-Id: I5ecd9e75beb4da7eb9c36efbe91034067f343344

EGit allows for comparisons with three remote revisions (notably through

subject: GitFileHistory should return the full history of its target.
message:
GitFileHistory should return the full history of its target.

When using GitFileHistoryProvider.getFileHistoryFor(IResource,...), a
user expects the full history of the target resource to be returned,
except if the SINGLE_REVISION or SINGLE_LINE_OF_DESCENT flags are
positioned.

The SINGLE_REVISION flag is properly handled, however when no flags are
set, EGit previously returned only the commits descending from HEAD,
without considering the history that exists on other branches or
references.

This adds specific tests to make sure of the behavior when either no
flag or the SINGLE_REVISION flag are set.

The history's "getTarget" and "getContributors" were rewritten to allow
for some of Team quirks: when using the synchronize view, Team will use
its own file revisions instead of what was originally fed to it. We thus
need to adapt those revisions to types known to us. A specific test
demonstrating this use case has been added.

Change-Id: I67720110a47048fb85074a1cbbcb3d4205618a67

subject: Eliminate file handle leaks
message:
Eliminate file handle leaks

Running the SWTBot test suite on a windows environment highlights an
insidious file handle leaks coming from the WindowCache used in
conjunction with JGit parsed repositories. ".pack" files are opened for
reading and thus locked for deletion until the repo is properly closed,
but EGit might not keep a reference towards this repository in its
cache, "forgetting" to close it when needed. This is mostly true for
sub-modules.

This patch also gets rid of other random errors : an URL missing from
a configured remote repository, making the "push" fail, a .project not
properly removed...

subject: [UI RFC] Publish branch/initial push wizard
message:
[UI RFC] Publish branch/initial push wizard

With certain workflows (non-Gerrit), creating a branch and pushing it to
a remote (including setup of branch tracking) is a common operation.
Currently, this is pretty complicated with EGit and a source of errors,
bug reports and help requests.

This change tries to provide a solution for the following use cases:

* The user created a new repository and wants to push it for the first
  time (no remotes yet).

* The user created a new feature branch and wants to push it to a
  remote, and set up tracking in the same step (git push -u).

It adds an additional wizard and provides it in place of the "push to
upstream" action when no tracking branch is configured yet. It's also
available in the context menu of a branch in the repositories view.

subject: Only include resources that are part of the data set in synchronize
message:
Only include resources that are part of the data set in synchronize

Workspace synchronization is launched on a given repository (or "a
project of a given repository"). This repository may contain commits
on files that were not imported in the workspace. In such a case, the
GitContainerMapping corresponding to that commit shouldn't create
traversals for the files that are not in the workspace, as that would
fail later on in NPEs.

This improvement may also serve as a basis to allow a "synchronize
project" (or "synchronize folder") action instead of "synchronize
workspace"; i.e. restrict the scope of a synchronization to only part
of a repository.

subject: DRAFT - factorize comparison and synchronization code
message:
DRAFT - factorize comparison and synchronization code

* Use the same code for all comparison actions, making sure that
a comparison launches a synchronization instead when there is more
than a single resource to compare (either when the user selected
more than one resource or when the selected resource is part of a
larger logical model).
* Remove all now useless code from the comparison action handlers,
CompareUtil and GitSynchronizeModel.
* Allow GitSynchronizeData to filter on a set of resources instead
of filtering on a set of containers. This finer-grained filtering
allows us to constrain the scope of synchronization operations.
* Remove useless overrides from GitModelTree and GitModelRepository.

Change-Id: I4ae8abfc4dbe7ed772749afa80743278247585ee

end. So implement flush in DocumentOutputStream to make sure the
document is complete.

subject: Fixed bug #406922: stronger checks for handling linked resources.
message:
Fixed bug #406922: stronger checks for handling linked resources.

The fix provides stronger checks on selected linked resources before
enabling menu items. In particular, linked resources that point to a
file that is part of a project shared with egit are allowed to be
operated on. Otherwise team actions are disabled if the selection
contains a linked resource pointing to a file outside any project and
repository. A default isEnabled() implementation is provided for this
behavior. After adding a test case a couple more handlers have been
amended and made compliant.

subject: Gerrit doesn't need /p anymore
message:
Gerrit doesn't need /p anymore

Since Gerrit 2.3 the path segment /p is not needed anymore when
accessing Gerrit with the http protocol [1].

This patch was initially created because there was a bug in Gerrit when
pushing with /p [2], which has been fixed in the meantime. When testing
the change, bug 407984 was detected.

The logic to add /p is removed from the Gerrit Configuration wizard in
order to fix bug 407984, avoid unnecessary complexity and because
Gerrit 2.3 is deprecated since a long time: 2.3 was released in April
2012, the latest release is 2.5.4 and 2.6 will be released soon.

[1] http://gerrit-documentation.googlecode.com/svn/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotes-2.3.html#_miscellaneous
    (see "Support http://server/project for Git access")
[2] https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=393735

Bug: 407984
Change-Id: I4bcadeb323220918c13e9a43205d9546ad75096e
Signed-off-by: Matthias Sohn <matthias.sohn@sap.com>
Signed-off-by: Stefan Lay <stefan.lay@sap.com>

subject: Configure Branch: Show correct refs when remote is selected
message:
Configure Branch: Show correct refs when remote is selected

The "merge" key in a branch section of .git/config describes the name of
the branch as it is called on the remote. So it contains e.g.
"refs/heads/master", not "refs/remotes/origin/master".

The dialog for configuring a branch (repo view > Configure Branch...)
just showed all refs, making it likely for users to configure the wrong
thing.

It now calculates the refs based on the value of the remote entry, by
mapping remote tracking refs back to how they are called on the remote
(according to the fetch specs) and only showing the matching refs.

Because the values in the branch combo now depend on the values in the
remote combo, show the remote combo first (for a clear flow).

Bug: 407465
Change-Id: I9c45fa470b6335ddb6a7b1beaf17cc2257f120a1

subject: [stagingView] Fix deletion of files when dragging from Navigator view
message:
[stagingView] Fix deletion of files when dragging from Navigator view

In NavigatorDragAdapter, used by the Navigator view, dragFinished
deletes the dragged resources when the operation was DND.DROP_MOVE.

This resulted in the dragged files being deleted when dropping onto the
"Unstaged Changes" or "Staged Changes" in the Staging view.

This was the case even before bug 385412 introduced the possibility to
stage via drag and drop from Package Explorer.

The reason that this bug didn't occur with the Package Explorer is
because it doesn't delete files after DND.DROP_MOVE (which seems like a
more sane behavior).

subject: Fix scheduling rule error when ignoring resources in nested projects
message:
Fix scheduling rule error when ignoring resources in nested projects

The problem was that IgnoreOperation#calcSchedulingRule and
IgnoreOperation#addIgnore used different methods to get an IContainer
from the IPath. In case of nested projects, this could result in them
getting different IContainers, which lead to an error like "Attempted to
beginRule: /container1, does not match outer scope rule /container2".

To make the test case check the rule, it had to be wrapped in a job.

subject: [stagingView] Fix spurious warning if view was hidden when input set
message:
[stagingView] Fix spurious warning if view was hidden when input set

See bug for how to reproduce. The fix consists of two parts:

1. Change isVisible to getVisible.

For isVisible to be true, the parents of also have to be visible. In the
case of the warning label, we also want to correctly toggle it even if
e.g. the staging view is not currently visible.

2. Rework modify handlers

Instead of requiring users of CommitMessageComponent to handle modify
events of author/committer texts themselves, handle it in the component.
The advantage of this is that the message does not have to be updated
when the listeners in the component are disabled. Before this, a warning
would theoretically be shown for a brief moment when authorText.setText
was called inside updateUI but the committer was not yet set.

The first part alone would have been enough to fix the problem. The
second part improves the code by making it simpler.

due to not calling TreeWalk.forPath for each entry.

"Gerrit Configuration..." on a remote node in the repo view is the only
Gerrit menu that's shown when a repo is not configured for Gerrit.

To test whether Gerrit is configured, the following is used:

* Is "gerrit.createchangeid" set to true in Git config?
* Are there any remotes with a push refspec where the destination starts
  with "refs/for/"?

subject: Enable to inject custom home directory for tests
message:
Enable to inject custom home directory for tests

On the egit Hudson server the home directory is located on a NFS
filesystem. This leads to problems when tests which create test files
under the home directory fail to delete files they have created there
due to limitations of the NFS filesystem. Hence enable to inject a
custom home directory for these tests. Set the system property
"custom.user.home" to specify a custom directory.

Bug: 414509
Change-Id: If549e4c75d53a63f27d33401385b168bd0f236ff
Signed-off-by: Matthias Sohn <matthias.sohn@sap.com>

Ensure test directories don't clash

run concurrently (e.g. on Hudson).

subject: Improve usability of "Create New Tag" dialog
message:
Improve usability of "Create New Tag" dialog

* Use hints to have a sane size after opening dialog without having to
  hardcode minimum size
* Make sure advanced content becomes visible when expanded
* Instead of changing "enabled" state of text widgets, change
  "editable". This makes it possible to always select text.
* Always enable editing of tag name field, even after existing tag was
  selected. This allows to select an existing name and then edit it,
  which is useful for version numbers where only the last part changes.
* Use the same key stroke to activate "OK" as in staging view
* Add a "clear" icon to the tag name text field
* Also allow to replace an existing tag when its name was entered in the
  tag name text field. Before, this was only possible when selecting it
  on the right.

This also removes some unused code and releases a RevWalk.

subject: Fix scheduling rule error when ignoring resources in nested projects
message:
Fix scheduling rule error when ignoring resources in nested projects

The problem was that IgnoreOperation#calcSchedulingRule and
IgnoreOperation#addIgnore used different methods to get an IContainer
from the IPath. In case of nested projects, this could result in them
getting different IContainers, which lead to an error like "Attempted to
beginRule: /container1, does not match outer scope rule /container2".

To make the test case check the rule, it had to be wrapped in a job.

Bug: 410011
Change-Id: Id03daa1db356b8dbd0b4ad1b07173760b3e1bc75
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>
Signed-off-by: Matthias Sohn <matthias.sohn@sap.com>

subject: Consider IResource.getLocation() being null
message:
Consider IResource.getLocation() being null

For non-local projects, i.e. ones backed by other EFS implementations,
IResource.getLocation() is designed to return null (cf.
getLoactionURI()).  Honor this fact by checking return values of
getLocation().

Bug: 413887
Change-Id: I7591ce439dc8e3719965a4516c9eb4692cfd5acb
Signed-off-by: Christian Georgi <christian.georgi@sap.com>

message:
Fix potential NPE from passing null as progress monitor

Even though the javadoc advertizes it, a few model providers will not
accept "null" as a progress monitor. Use the NullProgressMonitor
instead to be on the safe side.

It now requires the user to explicitly check that the .git dir should be
deleted before the dialog can be confirmed. It also displays a warning

The paths are now shown below the checkbox for better alignment and to

subject: RepositoryAction: Only calculate isEnabled if relevant selection changes
message:
RepositoryAction: Only calculate isEnabled if relevant selection changes

When selecting text in a text editor or moving the cursor,
selectionChanged is called many times with an ITextSelection.

In case of a text selection, we are only interested in which file the
selection is in. To get rid of some unnecessary cycles, only calculate
isEnabled if the selection changed after the interesting parts are
extracted.

Bug: 415958
Change-Id: I52416d0386a60d15b19d0a32755b016c2f3419eb

Signed-off-by: Matthias Sohn <matthias.sohn@sap.com>

subject: Fix inefficient implementation of GitScopeOperation
message:
Fix inefficient implementation of GitScopeOperation

The problem before was that it executed an expensive "git status"
operation for each resource, even when the resource was in the same
repository.

It now processes the resources grouped by repository and uses the cached
index diff data from IndexDiffCache.

Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

the ClassCastException and add a test case.
