Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: Do not abort when the user tries to start a nested rebase
message:
Do not abort when the user tries to start a nested rebase

When the user tries to start rebase in the middle of another rebase do
not abort since this could destroy the work done while resolving
conflicts in the first rebase. Instead display a warning and give hints
how to proceed.

Bug: 416136
Change-Id: I05054b6c7f6a49f4cd01d70ee44791e6985e9ee5

subject: [historyView] Prevent nested merge and cherry-pick
message:
[historyView] Prevent nested merge and cherry-pick

When a merge, cherry-pick or rebase is already in progress the commands
merge and cherry-pick need to be disabled since we can't nest these
operations.

Change-Id: I358e9ef787de93c92ce12d3c9a320ec5dc928e66
Signed-off-by: Matthias Sohn <matthias.sohn@sap.com>

subject: GitSyncObjectCache erroneously changes the sync state of resources
message:
GitSyncObjectCache erroneously changes the sync state of resources

When using the mapping context to determine the synchronization state
of individual resources, the GitSyncObjectCache changes all other
resources' state to "in-sync"... and never looks back. This causes
very weird issues when using Team APIs, and a totally unspecified
behavior such as a resource going from "MODIFIED" to "IN-SYNC" for no
obvious reason.

Bug: 415430
Change-Id: Ib9d3686e87a5cb490a55b3a379b81b0fc0b1c3d9
Also-by: Laurent Goubet <laurent.goubet@obeo.fr>
Also-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>
Signed-off-by: Mikaël Barbero <mikael.barbero@obeo.fr>

subject: Add refresh of linked folder to LinkedResourcesTest
message:
Add refresh of linked folder to LinkedResourcesTest

Maybe this will fix the occasional failures on Hudson:

https://hudson.eclipse.org/egit/job/egit-stable.gerrit/155/

Change-Id: Ia175a29fe9df0fe12cc67a0be974aed877264e31
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: Offer to create branch when checking out remote-tracking branch
message:
Offer to create branch when checking out remote-tracking branch

A common mistake for new users of EGit is that they want to work on a
branch existing on a remote and therefore check out the remote-tracking
branch. Instead the right thing to do would have been to create a new
local branch based on it.

This change shows a question whether to create a new local branch or
whether to check out the commit behind the remote-tracking branch.

To make it clear that there will be a question, the label is
"Checkout..." instead of "Checkout" when a remote-tracking branch is
selected.

Bug: 341679
Change-Id: I8701aee4bb12de0848f4820a3f7725435cbf106d
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: Fix compare editor element label for "file not in commit"
message:
Fix compare editor element label for "file not in commit"

Passing the commit object results in toString of RevCommit to be used,
which is not for display in the UI.

Change-Id: Id96308c8db2d0930d3f342b5c8b8009de34b6131
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: [sync] Fix addition/deletion of incoming commit being reversed
message:
[sync] Fix addition/deletion of incoming commit being reversed

When a file is added as part of an incoming commit, it should not be
shown as deleted and vice versa. I don't know why this was done in the
first place.

There was also confusion about what the LEFT and RIGHT direction mean in
the context of synchronization. The static block in
org.eclipse.compare.CompareConfiguration shows that LEFT is incoming and
RIGHT is outgoing.

Bug: 416374
Change-Id: I4b68e2b35b50fe207180e4313868c1bcfecd87c2
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: Fix showing annotations for deleted file from file diff viewer
message:
Fix showing annotations for deleted file from file diff viewer

Because getNewPath was used, which returns /dev/null for deleted files,
the path could not be found and the following error was shown:

  File /dev/null is not contained in commit

This fixes it by using the old path in case of a delete.

Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: Schedule a job to abort or skip a stopped rebase
message:
Schedule a job to abort or skip a stopped rebase

This ensures that the rebase abort or skip operation are executed in the
background and that the appropriate scheduling rule acquires a workspace
lock so that builders don't interfere.

RebaseHelper and AbstractRebaseCommandHandler already behave in this way
but the RebaseResultDialog didn't.

message:
Perform CRLF conversion when saving index in partial staging

Before, it would just copy over the bytes as they were in the editor
(with working directory EOLs). So they ended up in the index and in the
repository.

Now we perform input CRLF conversion on save if configured.

Also gets rid of some unnecessary array copies in EditableRevision.

message:
[stagingView] Fix selection after showing view initially

How to reproduce:

1. Close the view
2. Select a file in a project connected to a repo
3. Show the staging view

Expected: The view is linked with the repo from step 2
Actual: It shows "No Repository Selected"

The problem was that getActivePart in the old code returned null in the
above case. Going via the active workbench window didn't change that.
What works is getting it via execution context.

subject: [historyView] Include annotated tags with "Show All Branches and Tags"
message:
[historyView] Include annotated tags with "Show All Branches and Tags"

When a commit was only reachable through an annotated tag, it was not
shown in the history view even when using the show all option.

The problem was that parseAny returns a RevTag for annotated tags, not a
RevCommit. By peeling the returned object, we get the commit the tag
points to and include it in the walk.

subject: Make the rebase command stop after initialization
message:
Make the rebase command stop after initialization

Preparing the rebase todo lines in a callback method may be a long
lasting user interaction. Doing this with the callback method
prepareSteps(...) in the RebaseInteractiveHandler implies to make the
thread that is calling back sleep until the user has finished
preparation. When the rebase command is returning after initialization
there is no need to make a thread sleep. The rebase todo file can be
edited via writeRebaseTodoFile(...) of the Repository class. The rebase
(interactive) has then to be invoked with PROCESS_STEPS in order to
start the processing.  Note that the Method prepareSteps(...) of the
RebaseInteractiveHandler will be called anyway just before starting to
process the rebase todo file.

Depends on JGit Change-Id: Change-Id:
I2d6f0de82010ea6523fbce6fb4501e847bdcdddc

Change-Id: I52a1fdae82308f3c7e4e4950b007e83807d0ae41
Signed-off-by: Tobias Pfeifer <to.pfeifer@sap.com>

subject: [stagingView] Start with "auto expand" mode initially
message:
[stagingView] Start with "auto expand" mode initially

As a default, I think having the tree expanded makes more sense than
collapsed, so that the files can be seen instead of just some parent
folders. Using the compact tree, I caught myself always pressing "Expand
All" as the first step after starting Eclipse, and I've seen other
people being bothered by having to expand the nodes (I don't know why
they didn't use the "Expand All" button though).

In the list view, we were always showing all files, so performance
should not be a problem. And as soon as the user collapses a node, "auto
expand" is disabled as implemented in an earlier change.

In the future, we could also consider persisting the state.

Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: Fix regression of switched sides in "Compare with Version in Ancestor"
message:
Fix regression of switched sides in "Compare with Version in Ancestor"

In EGit 3.0, the "new" state was shown on the left and the "old" on the
right, which is consistent with other Eclipse usage, see bug 213780.

In the fix for bug 416808, the sides were switched (probably not
intentionally).

This restores the order and also renames the parameters in the compare
methods to be more clear. It's now also more consistent with how
includeLocal is handled, as local is shown on the left and uses the
"old" parameter for the right side.

subject: Only decorate background color if it's not set to default
message:
Only decorate background color if it's not set to default

Some toolkit themes may add alternating line colors or other additional
visual clues to the tree widget. If the decoration for uncommitted
changes or ignored resources always sets the background color, these
visuals are painted over.

This change fixes this by not setting the background color if the user
did not actually configure something other than the default color. See
plugin.xml for the default color being COLOR_LIST_BACKGROUND.

subject: Fix compare when file is not contained in common ancestor
message:
Fix compare when file is not contained in common ancestor

When a version of a file was compared with another version in three-way
mode and the file was not contained in the common ancestor, the compare
editor did not show the differences but showed the whole files as
conflicting. The user had to switch to two-way compare in order to
see the diffs.

Now the compare editor is always opened in two-way compare mode if there
is no file contained in the common ancestor commit.

Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: Warn when switching branches and a launch is running for the repo
message:
Warn when switching branches and a launch is running for the repo

On certain cumbersome platforms (looking at you, Windows), a branch
switch may fail when something is running that uses the files. In case
of launch configurations inside Eclipse, we can detect that and warn the
user about it.

We could even offer to terminate it, but as termination may be async, we
just offer continue/cancel. The user can also choose to not show any
warnings again.

The code for detecing this searches the ISourceContainer of the launches
to see if one is for a project of the repository. This works e.g. for
"Java Application" run configurations and also for servers (WST). I
first tried ILaunchConfiguration#getMappedResources, but it does not
return anything for servers. Maybe there is an easier way, but I
couldn't find it.

See bug for how to test this with servers.

Bug: 419296
Change-Id: I2fd7459b0cf342c13dda087745bd68dc1b6da4c3
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: [repoView] Improve performance of tags (label provider)
message:
[repoView] Improve performance of tags (label provider)

Before, parsing the tags was done in different places. For the image
(annotated vs lightweight), the tag was always parsed. For the check
mark when tag is checked out, the tag was parsed again. And in case of
the option "Display Latest Branch Commit" being enabled, the tag was
parsed a third time.

With this change, each tag is parsed only once in the content provider
and the result is stored in the TagNode. Also, it uses one RevWalk
instance instead of N.

subject: Fix UI tests interfering with each other because of shared test setup
message:
Fix UI tests interfering with each other because of shared test setup

The most common cause of unstable UI tests was that the test data
(repositories and projects) was set up once per class, and then each
test method used the same data. When one test method only reads the data
but another modifies it, the test may fail depending on the order of
execution.

This is an attempt to fix this by changing the test setup so that it's
done once per test method (@Before instead of @BeforeClass). To make it
easier (and possibly faster) to clean up and reduce the possibility of
accidentally sharing the data, the data for each test method is created
in a separate directory.

Change-Id: I2d7ae4e86c08483a1e8a2824a31648f9d6827bf8
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: Change test execution to find all tests instead of using suites
message:
Change test execution to find all tests instead of using suites

There are multiple problems with using suites:

* They need to be kept up-to-date manually. There were some test classes
  which were not referenced by suites and therefore never executed in
  the Maven build. See parent changes for some examples. Before this
  change, the output said "Tests run: 266", after: "Tests run: 311".
* When executing tests in Eclipse by selecting a project or package,
  tests in suites are executed twice. In case of hierarchical
  suites, it's even more than twice.

subject: Fix misleading error message in clone wizard
message:
Fix misleading error message in clone wizard

When a remote repository could not be reached there was a dialog which
only described some of the possible scenarios. Moreover, it always
proposed to look at the ssh preferences, even if ssh was not used.

We now give more explanation about possible failures. Possible errors
in case of ssh or https are only shown when these protocols are used.

The Exception was not logged, this is fixed now as well.

In further change we could also react on the concrete type of the
Exception thrown inside JGit. E.g., an
org.eclipse.jgit.errors.NoRemoteRepositoryException would indicate that
there is no network problem but a wrong repository path.

subject: Blame annotations: Show diff in hover and enable blaming parent commits
message:
Blame annotations: Show diff in hover and enable blaming parent commits

This change extends the information that is shown when hovering over a
annotation revision:

A diff to each parent (normally just one) is shown. Only the hunk
concerning the current line is used to keep the diff small. This helps
in understanding what the blamed commit changed in the current line.

The text above the diff shows the parent commit ID and includes a link
to show the annotations of this parent commit. When clicked, a new
editor is opened for showing annotations for that commit. It also jumps
to the correct line.

Together, this enables quickly going through the history of a file and
inspect the changes that happened over time.

Change-Id: I11793926570a057577c6de04c3a8bda28521d71d

offers a better alternative by listing the commits in a dialog.

subject: Blame annotations: Show start commit when opening editor
message:
Blame annotations: Show start commit when opening editor

Before, the commit that was shown was the blamed commit from the cursor
position, which could be confusing to the user.

To solve this, two things needed to be changed:

The first time a selection changed event happens for the revision
selection provider, we ignore it as it is for the "initial" selection.
The confusing thing about this is that the user has not yet consciously
selected a revision. To fix this, we now always ignore the very first
selection.

When opening an editor with annotation for a start commit (e.g. for the
show annotations link in a hover), we now show this commit in the
history view.

Bug: 422100
Change-Id: I5e1e529684f298b51fea5ccf99f18d901b874c5a
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: Blame annotations: Add link for showing commit in history and open
message:
Blame annotations: Add link for showing commit in history and open

Showing only an abbreviated commit ID makes room for adding two links,
one for opening the commit (before, this was the link on the commit ID
itself), and one for showing it in the history view. With this, both
actions are now explicit.

subject: Use different icons for start/continue interactive rebase

Before, every time getChildren was called (for each node), all files and
folders were scanned to find the children. The more tree nodes there
are, the more this hurts, as the complexity is quadratic.

subject: Do not allow rebase if there are uncommitted changes
message:
Do not allow rebase if there are uncommitted changes

With this change egit checks for uncommitted changes before a rebase is
started. The user can choose from a dialog how to handle this situation.
In a further change we could offer the feature to automatically re-apply
the stashed change after finishing or aborting the rebase.

Note that this change is done in EGit. Therefore the Pull operation is
not affected.

subject: Add a helper method to find repository from given resource path
message:
Add a helper method to find repository from given resource path

In most cases we can use RepositoryMapping to find the repository
responsible for versioning a given resource. But the team framework
doesn't allow to use RepositoryMappings to find the repository for
resources in a closed project. Hence add a helper method to find the
repository based on comparison of resource path and the working tree
path of all repositories known to the RepositoryCache.

Change-Id: I8d26d5a6ed4aa6661eb88d540ab643fb3b6cebbc
Signed-off-by: Matthias Sohn <matthias.sohn@sap.com>

subject: [historyView] Enable to run commands when input is in a closed project
message:
[historyView] Enable to run commands when input is in a closed project

The team framework doesn't allow to lookup the RepositoryMapping for
resources located in a closed project. Hence we need to handle this
using path comparisons of working tree path of all known repositories
with the input's resource path.

Change-Id: I1d6e089cafbf5757877e149c0488f5ff12e99a2e

subject: [stagingView] Store IFile/IContainer for entries
message:
[stagingView] Store IFile/IContainer for entries

Instead of calculating the resource on each access, calculate them once
and store them in a field. With 4000 unstaged changes in a test
repository, this brought down the time to expand all elements from 3
seconds to 500-800 ms.

Maybe getting the resources could be made faster by not using
findFilesForLocationURI/findContainersForLocationURI, but instead going
through the projects of the repository and using getFile/getFolder and
only falling back to the above in case nothing is found.

Bug: 420825
Change-Id: I86f0e09fad54d63e7e76ae3541178ae80c867144
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: [stagingView] Improve performance of switching presentation
message:
[stagingView] Improve performance of switching presentation

On a test repository with 4000 changed files, switching between
presentations was 6 seconds before, 1 second after this change.

One problem was that expanding the previously expanded elements was
unnecessarily done when switching presentations.

Also, the refresh was done twice because run() is also called for the
deselected action. See bug 422910 about improving the documentation of
IAction.AS_RADIO_BUTTON.

on" instead.

[1] http://www.eclipse.org/forums/index.php/t/608953/

Change-Id: I090e3039a10d5465e19b80912d7a81052e519310
Signed-off-by: Matthias Sohn <matthias.sohn@sap.com>

subject: Fix "overlaps the location of another project" when importing
message:
Fix "overlaps the location of another project" when importing

Given the following:

* Git repository containing a .project at the root of the repository
* .project contains "foo" as project name
* Repository is called "bar" on the server

Do the following:

1. Start the Git import wizard
2. Clone the repository directly into the workspace (e.g. /home/ws and
   clone destination is /home/ws/bar)
3. Select "Import existing projects"
4. Finish

Expected: The project is successfully imported
Actual: Error "/home/ws/bar overlaps the location of another project:
bar"

This change fixes it by using the same logic as platform uses, see
WizardProjectsImportPage.ProjectRecord.

Bug: 327975
Change-Id: I23939def6d1a3b88a0812b53fee98a403a664c23
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: Import wizard: Move page init code from getNextPage to setVisible
message:
Import wizard: Move page init code from getNextPage to setVisible

getNextPage can be called multiple times (and even before the page is
really shown), so getNextPage should not be doing any work for the page.

setVisible seems to be the right place for this, see other wizards. With
this, the logic is only called once and it seems to fix the problem
described in the comments of I23939def6d1a3b88a0812b53fee98a403a664c23.

message:
Make Merge Tool work for non-workspace files

It should even work for a repository that does not even have a single
project in the workspace (I don't know why one would actually do that
though).

Bug: 421734
Change-Id: Ic4d8c3f37b7d584f13f52fb819a0e924babaee35
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: [stagingView] Fix rebase buttons being shown after startup
message:
[stagingView] Fix rebase buttons being shown after startup

When the staging view is shown after startup and it's still
initializing, the rebase buttons were shown for a time, and then hidden
after initialization was finished.

The reason was that updateRebaseButtonVisibility schedules the hiding
using Display#asyncExec. When called from createPartControl, this is not
necessary, so hide it directly there.

Change-Id: Ibb6fc5f0fb2c28ace76159a4d71ad273718387c9
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: [stagingView] Fix flickering when switching between repos
message:
[stagingView] Fix flickering when switching between repos

When switching from a repo that is in the normal state to one that has
conflicts, a warning for "invalid committer" was briefly shown and then
hidden again, causing some flickering.

The reason was that the text fields are set to "" in case of conflicts,
which triggered the warning, only to be removed again later. So make
sure that setting to "" is done at the end and also don't cause any
"statusUpdated" events when the fields are not enabled.

Change-Id: I02dc7c9585d004496c39f635bc52d440fdf2cde2
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: Strip git clone from pasted URL
message:
Strip git clone from pasted URL

Gerrit and Gitblit add git clone to the URLs their wizards add to the
clipboard. When pasting these URLs into EGit the wizard doesn't
recognize these and displays an error. For convenience, strip git clone
from the pasted text before converting them to an URI.

Change-Id: If24def9bf4b7289bbaabff8fcee8f5046ec2001a
Signed-off-by: Sascha Vogt <sascha@vogt-neuenbuerg.de>

subject: Fix importing of submodule repositories using Git 1.7.8 layout
message:
Fix importing of submodule repositories using Git 1.7.8 layout

The submodule Git directory is in .git/modules/$mod and the .git in the
submodule directory is a text file with "gitdir: ../.git/modules/$mod".

This change includes three parts:

* Use FileRepositoryBuilder in RepositoryFinder to find repos, because
  it already knows how to handle the above format
* Fix GitProjectData to handle RepositoryMapping where getGitDirPath
  returns an absolute path (IPath#append just ignores that)
* Fix ExistingOrNewPage to be able to handle absolute paths where the
  Git directory is not below the worktree path

Bug: 378611
Change-Id: Iecf1c85f4d24b153ac734b3bd615e72fdfcb3717
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: Fix ContainerTreeIterator and RepositoryMapping for submodule repos
message:
Fix ContainerTreeIterator and RepositoryMapping for submodule repos

For submodule repositories, the first repository that is found that
contains the a path in its worktree may be the parent repository. So use
the one with the best match in RepositoryMapping.

In ContainerTreeIterator, just use the passed Repository for calculating
the prefix instead of searching for the mapping again.

Note that JGit change I0c00953f73f9316a66d0fc10eab52d8779c88f00 is also
necessary for the decorations to work correctly, see bug 423644.

Bug: 392378
Change-Id: Ib67a4593c49b29ed6d0c8357493f227707f7ad9e
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: Fix displayed name of submodule repo with Git 1.7.8 layout
message:
Fix displayed name of submodule repo with Git 1.7.8 layout

It would just use the parent directory name, which is always "modules"
for submodule repos being stored in .git/modules/$mod. This would be
confusing in the repositories view.

Instead, use the name of the worktree directory for non-bare
repositories.

Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: Improve order of menu entries in "Replace With" and "Compare With"
message:
Improve order of menu entries in "Replace With" and "Compare With"

This changes the order by reordering the existing actions. Note that the
order in plugin.xml has to be the reverse of what is desired in the
popup menu. It also changes "Replace With > File in Git Index" to be
consistent with "Compare With > Git Index".

The previous changes for this also converted the menu from being defined
via the deprecated org.eclipse.ui.popupMenus extension point to
org.eclipse.ui.menus, but that caused bug 422907 (a bug in Platform UI).

Change-Id: I6954f5ad684cc235841e32599e2ef36efa39d0b7
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: Create Branch: Change source selection from combo to selection dialog
message:
Create Branch: Change source selection from combo to selection dialog

When a repository has many branches or tags, the selection with the
combo is ineffective (e.g. no filtering). Apart from that, it slows down
the dialog even when the user does not intend to change the source
branch.

This changes it to a "Select..." button which shows a branch selection
dialog where the user can filter.

To clean up the appearance, an icon is shown for the source branch
representing the type and the short branch/tag name is used (that's the
name the user sees everywhere else).

Bug: 422661
Change-Id: Icfaabed13f890f5b8abb0833e847a76e648f0b86
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>
Signed-off-by: Matthias Sohn <matthias.sohn@sap.com>

subject: Fix endless loop of GenerateHistoryJob
message:
Fix endless loop of GenerateHistoryJob

The GenerateHistoryJob was scheduled over and over when the following
precondiations were met:

 - The preference "Team > Git > History > Maximum number of commits to 
   show" has to be set to a numer smaller than the number of commits
   in a repository
 - The history of the repository is fully loaded into the History view
 - The user scrolls down to the end

Scrolling triggers the event listener added in the constructor of 
CommitGraphTable (This is done to implement incremental loading).
The event listener calls the method loadItem of GitHistory Page to load
a given commit specified by its index. This method asks the 
GenerateHistoryJob if the commit is less than BATCH_SIZE / 2 away from 
the end, and if so, triggers a new GenerateHistoryJob.

After loading the commits the GenerateHistoryJob wrongly computed the
value of the incomplete variable. It did not check if all commits of 
the history were loaded. Because of that the updateUI method did render
the UI again leading to another call of the event listener above.

This commit adds a check if all commits are loaded. 
This is unfortunately not easily done with the SWTCommitList.

So we check if no new commits were loaded in the current invocation of 
the GenerateHistoryJob and in that case step out of the loop before 
the check for incomplete is done. Then the method updateUI in 
GenerateHistoryJob will not render the UI again and not start the 
endless loop anymore.

But the updateUI method has to render the UI once more after all 
commits are loaded. This is ensured by the new field
forcedRedrawsAfterListIsCompleted.

Change-Id: Ice8c59d537156a52acb80c8e004e838e279cdbe3

This adds a new menu item Modify > Squash to the context menu
of the history view. It can be used to squash multiple (contiguous)
selected commits into one, prompting for a commit message as well.

An error will be displayed if the selected commits cannot be reached
from the current HEAD commit. This is done so as to avoid the need
to checkout another commit automatically before executing the squash
procedure.

The "Modify" sub-menu is chosen so that new menu items (such as
"Reword" or "Edit") can be added to it rather than the history
context menu directly.

subject: Prevent premature UI refreshes by batching resource changed events
message:
Prevent premature UI refreshes by batching resource changed events

All long running operations which may potentially lead to premature UI
refreshes e.g. by changing files in the file system should use
WorkspaceJob. This will batch resource change events until the job is
finished running and remove the overhead imposed by repeated UI
refreshes reacting on events trickling in if not batched.

See
http://help.eclipse.org/kepler/index.jsp?topic=%2Forg.eclipse.platform.doc.isv%2Fguide%2FresAdv_concurrency.htm

Change-Id: I5f029e38fcb3ab0a58baced5d95056b72d810f0a

subject: Remove delay in local repositories filter
message:
Remove delay in local repositories filter

When trying to filter the directory with the Android open source
repositories (around 1400 repos) there is a delay of several seconds
after each update of the filter mask.

The performance issue is caused by getting the checked items during
filter evaluation of each item completely again and therefore has O(n^2)
runtime. This change caches the checked items after each change of a
checkmark.

With the change there is no notable delay when filtering the same list
of 1400 repositories.

Change-Id: Iab65452ae62551c3f8e7a2ee594a5a238b802144
Signed-off-by: Michael Keppler <michael.keppler@gmx.de>

subject: Allow canceling the commit operation after save-during-commit
message:
Allow canceling the commit operation after save-during-commit

When a commit is performed, the user is asked to save all dirty editors.
Even if she does save some or all of them, the commit continues. The
changes that are saved, are not staged and thus not part of the commit.

If the user actually saved a file, we now ask her whether she wants to
cancel committing, to be able to stage the freshly saved files.

This only applies to commits via the staging view. The commit dialog
already allows the user to stage saved files without needing zo cancel.

subject: Reload GitDocument for Quick Diff in job instead of UI thread
message:
Reload GitDocument for Quick Diff in job instead of UI thread

When doing a pull, commit or other operations that change refs, existing
GitDocuments are reloaded. GitDocument is used for Quick Diff, which is
active when the user uses Quick Diff, or when "Show Annotations" was
called.

Doing this possibly expensive operation (it can involve rename
detection) on the UI thread blocks the UI, so do it in a background job
instead. Note that RemoteRevisionQuickDiffProvider (for CVS) of
eclipse.platform.team does it the same way.

Change-Id: Iccac6ebce9c63c2ccc95bda28134519d2f379e1b

subject: Show Annotations: Fix incorrect annotations when having local changes
message:
Show Annotations: Fix incorrect annotations when having local changes

How to reproduce:

1. Add a few lines in the middle of a tracked file
2. Save the file
3. Execute "Show Annotations"

Expected: The annotations for the lines below the added ones should be
correct.
Actual: They are at the wrong location (too far down)

The problem is that BlameCommand also reads the local file content when
startCommit is not set. But in Eclipse, local changes are already
handled by the Quick Diff provider. So before, they were accounted for
twice. By only blaming HEAD, the Quick Diff logic can work correctly.

subject: Fix GitQuickDiffProvider creating multiple GitDocuments for resource
message:
Fix GitQuickDiffProvider creating multiple GitDocuments for resource

getReference didn't check whether a document was already created, and
just created a new one, overwriting the already existing one.

This resulted in the existing GitDocument never being disposed, which in
turn caused unnecessary work being done in GitDocument#onRefsChanged,
slowing down operations.

That GitQuickDiffProvider#getReference can be called multiple times can
be seen by adding a breakpoint and then doing this:

1. Show annotations in a tracked file -> first call
2. Edit the file
3. Commit the changes -> second call

The check for RepositoryProvider can be removed as it's done anyway in
GitDocument.create.

subject: replace "can not" by "cannot" everywhere
message:
replace "can not" by "cannot" everywhere

In English, there seems to be a subtle difference in the meaning of "can
not" and "cannot", where "cannot" indicates an absolute impossibility,
while "can not <verb>" implies the possibility of actively chosing not
to do <verb>. In egit we therefore always want to use the "cannot"
variant in all comments and user interface texts.

subject: [sync] Only fetch when synchronizing with remote-tracking branch
message:
[sync] Only fetch when synchronizing with remote-tracking branch

For detecting whether a fetch is possible, just check if any of the data
has a dstRemoteName.

Because dstRemoteName was also set for HEAD and local branches (which
does not make much sense), GitSynchronizeData was adapted to only set
them in case of remote-tracking branches. The logic was also improved to
check the remote configs instead of just pattern matching.

I noticed that GitSynchronizeData's getSrcMerge was only used in tests
and getSrcRemoteName only used in PushAction. But there, isEnabled was
testing dstRemoteName, while runPushOperation was using srcRemoteName.
But dstRemoteName makes more sense, as it is used together with
getDstMerge. So, this change also removes the two unused fields,
including associated logic.

subject: Don't look for .git in subdirectories of project
message:
Don't look for .git in subdirectories of project

disappear. When this happens with "auto share", it's very confusing.

Other places in the code could also not really handle this, e.g. the
share wizard displayed the repository location as ".git", when it really
should have shown "sub/dir/.git".

Bug: 421573
Change-Id: I4489cdd3526a30b1d2d575040792897a92da0c6d
Signed-off-by: Robin Stocker <robin@nibor.org>

subject: [stagingView] Don't clear restored commit message state in the UI
message:
[stagingView] Don't clear restored commit message state in the UI

When viewing a repository in the Staging View for the first time after
starting Eclipse, the IndexDiff data for this repository is usually not
available yet. During StagingView.reload(), first the stored Staging
View state is restored. Then enableCommitWidgets(false) is called,
which disables everything, and worse, also clears the just restored
inputs, including the commit message.

When the IndexDiff for the repository becomes available, reload() will
be called again.
This change postpones restoring the view state to that time. This way
the restored commit (and amend etc.) state remains intact. With the
IndexDiff available, the inputs will not be cleared after restoring them
(unless there are conflicts to be resolved).

This change prepares for commit message restore after restarting
Eclipse.

Change-Id: I4fb24196bf07d4af9fa18b2a8390793e2057f6eb
Signed-off-by: Konrad Kügler <swamblumat-eclipsebugs@yahoo.de>

subject: Remove "job" from job name
message:
Remove "job" from job name

Job names are user visible text. They should not contain "job", as that

With this change, the repository is searched again (in parents) to find

automatically find the original repo.

when switching the repository displayed in the staging view.

prevent lost commit messages due to Eclipse restarts.

"pick". This allows toggling between "pick" and another action by
repeatedly clicking the button of the other action.

subject: Add support for cherry-picking multiple commits at once.
message:
Add support for cherry-picking multiple commits at once.

This modifies the Cherry Pick menu item in the History view such that
multiple selected commits may be cherry-picked at once, instead of
one-by-one.

If a conflict occurs during merging one of the commits, the whole
process will stop with an error message. The conflict then needs to be
resolved and committed. (This has not changed from the previous
behaviour.) After that, cherry-picking may be resumed manually with the
leftover commits.

Change-Id: I23d1339072c9557af530c9e3f8d6636cf24fbac1

  * -

subject: Use Eclipse resource model when checking if a path is ignored
message:
Use Eclipse resource model when checking if a path is ignored

Before, it would iterate over the file system directly. The callers of
the method work with the resource model, which can be out of sync.

This mismatch could cause isIgnored to return false (and the path being
added to .gitignore) because the file system doesn't contain the
directory/file that was asked for.

subject: [historyView] Performance regression fix: don't apply styles on mouse hover
message:

hover

Bug 427811 describes performance degradation due the by permanent text
widget style recomputation while hovering with the mouse over the diff
area in the history view. This widget style recalculation is not needed
because each time style ranges are recomputed, they are also applied to
the widget in addDoneListenerToFormatJob().

This commit simply removes unneeded setStyle() calls from mouse hover
listener and also private styleRanges field used to keep styles.

subject: [IndexDiffCacheEntry] Introduce IndexDiffUpdateJob to schedule resource updates
message:
[IndexDiffCacheEntry] Introduce IndexDiffUpdateJob to schedule resource
updates

The IndexDiffCacheEntry currently immediately schedules update jobs on
resource changes. Given a resource related task which affects multiple
resources in 'n' workspace changes (e.g. "clean compile" on n projects),
IndexDiffCacheEntry.scheduleUpdateJob() is called n times on same
repository, creating n jobs (which in worst case creates n threads in
Eclipse), running one after each other and creating n notifications on
completion. This significantly affects Eclipse UI performance on huge
git repositories.

To avoid this, one single (collecting resources) IndexDiffUpdateJob is
created and used per IndexDiffCacheEntry. On each resource change
pending changes are collected by this job, but instead of immediate
scheduling default delay of 400 milliseconds is used to schedule the
job. This reduces both memory consumption and overhead by reducing
notifications count to UI listeners.

Change-Id: I0922cf83623bd15fee80569b31986990028e7c9d

subject: Try to recover after deleting opened files on NFS
message:
Try to recover after deleting opened files on NFS

Fixes various LocalRepositoryTestCase based tests, which were failing if
executed on NFS mount, see Bug 440182. The current workaround doesn't
really checks for NFS (have no idea how to do this in Java) but allows
tests running on "/home" to run "delete" cleanup twice (second "delete"
round deletes unexpected nfs zombie files). The assumption is that this
workaround should at least help *nix users with their NFS mounted home
directories.

Ideally the tests should be fixed to properly cleanup opened .pack file
handles, but I've spent one day hunting the root cause on one single
test without success, due the asynchronous nature of the resources
creation/cleanup.

subject: Fix IteratorService performance on big repositories/workspaces
message:
Fix IteratorService performance on big repositories/workspaces

IWorkspaceRoot.findContainersForLocationURI(URI) method performs very
poor on big repositories and workspaces, and gets even worse with lot of
links in the workspace too.

The fix tries first to get the direct workspace resources map hit by
using IWorkspaceRoot.getContainerForLocation(IPath) and only if this
fails, fail over to the slow findContainersForLocationURI method.

This works very fast for almost all cases (constant execution time) and
adds only a small overhead if the matching project/folder is contained
in a *closed* project which overlaps location of another *opened*
project.

subject: [historyView] Use separate diff viewer instead of embedding into message
message:
[historyView] Use separate diff viewer instead of embedding into message

The diff viewer is the same as in the "Diff" tab of the commit viewer.
It still shares its scroll bar with the message.

The advantage is that when a file is selected, only the diff has to be
updated, not the whole message. We can also make the commit message
collapsible or extract other parts from the comment (such as the list of
branches/tags). Also, the hyperlink detectors now only run on the commit
message, not on the diff.

subject: Fix error due to overlapping StyleRanges in CommitMessageViewer
message:
Fix error due to overlapping StyleRanges in CommitMessageViewer

This was caused by using setStyleRanges in
I2cf1e67e23f8d32a5a88b45ea5839f51b90c853a. With the individual
setStyleRange method, overlapping was handled by StyledText.

By using setStyleRanges for the format job results first (which are
ordered and non-overlapping), we still get the better performance of
setting these in bulk. The hyperlink style ranges are then applied on
top to handle overlapping, but they should be much fewer in numbers.

Signed-off-by: Andreas Hermann <a.v.hermann@gmail.com>

subject: Interactive rebase view toolbar can incorrectly activate buttons
message:
Interactive rebase view toolbar can incorrectly activate buttons

Currently interactive rebase view plan toolbar can incorrectly handle
changeset table selection changes in case of multiple selected
changesets.
RebaseInteractiveStepActionToolBarProvider#mapActionItemsToSelection
activates corresponding button on the toolbar in case of single
selection and can deactivate all buttons in case on multi selection (if
selected changesets have different rebasing plans). Current
implementation does not handle situation in which another button needs
to be activated. For example, if previously selected changeset had
"reword" plan ("reword" button activated) and new selection is two
changesets with "fixup" plan then expected behaviour is to activate
"fixup" button, but actually "reword" button will remain activated. 

Proposed implementation always activates button corresponding to the
first selected changeset plan and deactivates this button if necessary
(i.e. selected changesets have different plans).

Bug: 441891
Change-Id: Ic6013d2857e8dfc439650692e2ee22031e6f61ec
Signed-off-by: Vadim Dmitriev <dmgloss@mail.ru>

subject: Fix deadlock caused by GitProjectData.logAndUnmapGoneMappedResource
message:
Fix deadlock caused by GitProjectData.logAndUnmapGoneMappedResource

Deadlock could occur as follows:

Thread 1: In GitProjectData.get/load, the class object is locked. In
case a mapped resource is gone, RepositoryProvider.unmap is called,
which waits for job run.

Thread 2: In a job run, GitProvider.getData is called, which waits to
lock the GitProjectData class.

There are also other situations, all of which are caused by
logAndUnmapGoneMappedResource calling RepositoryProvider.unmap. By doing
that in a job where the GitProjectData class is no longer locked, this
should be solved.

subject: Fix ContainerTreeIterator to return on-disk size of a folder
message:
Fix ContainerTreeIterator to return on-disk size of a folder

A ContainerTreeIterator always returned 0 as length of a directory. This
was inconsistent with JGits FileTreeIterator which asked the filesystem
object about the length. At least on unix filesystems the file-system
size of the directory was returned which was different from 0. On
Windows 0 was returned by java.io.File.
Because of this inconsistency folders containing submodules often have
been marked as dirty by mistake. The index was filled with data coming
from a FileTreeIterator (length!=0) while the ContainerTreeIterator
returned length==0.

This has been fixed by forcing ContainerTreeIterator to ask the
filesystem for the length of a folder.

Change-Id: I4b75ee1e875ead1d0d2f772056aca918d37d3ffd

subject: Use baseline instead of centerline in PlotRenderer
message:
Use baseline instead of centerline in PlotRenderer

If the text extent height of a to be rendered plot line is odd, then the
SWTPlotRenderer cannot calculate the correct Y position for drawing the
label and draws the label with a 1 pixel offset. SWT text drawing uses
the baseline as Y coordinate. Due to the given centerline API in the
AbstractPlotRenderer the overall calculation of the baseline for SWT is
effectively (height / 2) * 2, thereby rounding all odd heights downward
to the next even number.

This change pushes the division by 2 from the caller into the
implementations of drawText.

In addition, enabling antialiasing has been moved from the
SWTPlotRenderer to the CommitGraphTable itself. Otherwise the cell label
heights are calculated different (1 pixel more height with antialiasing
enabled) in the middle of painting a row. This issue seems to be
specific to Windows.

Changes have been tested on Ubuntu14.10/GTK and Windows 7.

already existing IWindowListener callbacks.

subject: avoid blinking cursor in merge result dialog
message:
avoid blinking cursor in merge result dialog

At least on Windows the merge result dialog shows a distracting blinking
cursor in the first label. Let's avoid this by making the OK button the

subject: Don't let ignored resources cause index update jobs.
message:
Don't let ignored resources cause index update jobs.

Changes to ignored resources cause deltas fired by eclipse. These deltas
will cause index update jobs even though there is nothing to do. In the
worst case, a lot of resources are changed, and even though nothing
happened to tracked files, a full re-index is done because the changed
resource count threshold was reached.

Change-Id: Ic8ab3a93cb877a7a896c9bd88a878eb35c29d046
Signed-off-by: Markus Duft <markus.duft@salomon.at>
Signed-off-by: Matthias Sohn <matthias.sohn@sap.com>

subject: Decrease job startup delay for IndexDiffCache updates
message:
Decrease job startup delay for IndexDiffCache updates

The fix for bug 417597 (https://git.eclipse.org/r/30261) can cause
performance problems for slow workspaces where *lot* of changes were
reported but the incremental index update is not fast enough.

Because the changes are collected until the previous job is done, if the
number of changes exceeds RESOURCE_LIST_UPDATE_LIMIT (1000) the full
index update will be triggered which costs even more time.

The proposed fix is to decrease the IndexDiffUpdateJob start delay from
400 to 10 ms, with the hope that this will help slow workspaces to
perform updates faster.

message:

In workspaces with lot of projects from the same repository the most
decorator time is spent on computing branch state of the same
repository. A repository/branch state weak hash map is introduced in
DecoratableResourceHelper to avoid redundant calculation of the
repository branch state. The map entries are invalidated by
GitLightweightDecorator on each index change.

subject: Let staging view use submodule repos
message:
Let staging view use submodule repos

If the staging view is linked to the selected resource and if that
resource belongs to a submodule then staging view should also run in
the context of the submodule repo. This allows to work with submodules
in a similar manner than with native git. If I want to do a commit in a
submodule repo then select a resource in that submodule repo and you can
use Staging view to prepare the commit in the submodule repo. In native
git you would "cd" to a folder containing a file from the submodule to
switch context from the containing repo to the submodule repo. In EGit
you have to select a resource from the submodule to achieve the same.

RepositoryMapping is enhanced by one method which can return a submodule
repository. In future RepositoryMapping could be further enhanced to 
support git submodules in general.

Always check if the number of changed files exceeds the magic limit for
incremental index updates. In case of huge repositories with lot of
ignored files (> 65000) the incremental merge of ignored lists can be
highly inefficient if the number of changed files is higher then 2000.

Added tests for job scheduling to make sure reload and update are used
as expected.

subject: [stagingview] "Updating index" should indicate that view is "busy"
message:
[stagingview] "Updating index" should indicate that view is "busy"

If we are linked, each time IndexDiffUpdateJob starts, indicate that the
view is busy (e.g. reload() will trigger this job in background!).

This is not the best solution if one has many repositories: on Eclipse
startup the view could be shown busy even if the right repository is
already updated, but practically it works fine. 

Usually one has not really many *huge* repositories in the same Eclipse
workspace which can delay startup for long time, and after startup is
done, index refresh usually happens for the current repository only
because index diff updates are started only on repositories where user
makes some changes or selects elements.

subject: Use Target Platform Definition DSL to generate target platforms
message:
Use Target Platform Definition DSL to generate target platforms

The "Target Platform Definition DSL and Generator" [1] heavily
simplifies maintenance of target platforms. It allows to modularize
target platform definitions which eliminates code duplication. The
.target files understood by P2 and Tycho are generated from .tpd files
which are written in the target platform definition DSL.

In order to edit .tpd files and generate .target files install the
"Target Platform Definition DSL and Generator" 2.0 or later [2]  (Note:
on Kepler you also need to add [3] to get Xtext 2.5 which is not
available by default on Kepler). This tools is needed only if you need
to change the Target Platform definition files (*.targetplatform and
*.tpd) and re-generate the *.target files. In normal development you do
not need this and can simply use the generated *.target themselves.

In addition
- update Orbit repository for 4.5 to Mars M5
- use latest released Orbit p2 repository for platform version Luna
  and earlier
- update hamcrest to 1.3 which is used by swtbot on newer platform
  versions
- update p2f file

[1] https://github.com/mbarbero/fr.obeo.releng.targetplatform
[2] http://mbarbero.github.io/fr.obeo.releng.targetplatform/p2/latest/
[3] http://download.eclipse.org/modeling/tmf/xtext/updates/releases/

Change-Id: Id0dfd18440211141ba8a16bdc7c8ed41f69fa9f4
Signed-off-by: Matthias Sohn <matthias.sohn@sap.com>

to determine whether a file is a part of a logical model or
not. When a file has been deleted locally, or when a file
has been created on one of the remote sides, the local side
is not enough to compute a full model. ModelProviders will
need access to the remote file data to take these "unknown"
files into account.

subject: Fix ResourceUtil performance on big repositories/workspaces
message:
Fix ResourceUtil performance on big repositories/workspaces

IWorkspaceRoot.findContainersForLocationURI(URI) and
findFilesForLocationURI(URI) methods performs very poor on big
repositories and workspaces, and gets even worse with lot of links in
the workspace too. Example is the staging view with 2000 changes files
on a huge workspace - updating the index is faster then updating the
staging view which uses ResourceUtil!

The fix tries first to get the direct workspace resources map hit by
using IWorkspaceRoot.get*ForLocation(IPath) and only if this
fails, fail over to the slow find*ForLocationURI methods.

This works very fast for almost all cases (constant execution time) and
adds only a small overhead if the matching project/folder is contained
in a *closed* project which overlaps location of another *opened*
project.

See also similar fix in IteratorService (bug 440722 commit
d3a78e05381ff38370ba6a6a1d6733d741d15f45).

Change-Id: I896980774503d52c900d5db8f2dae0b3023ce991

message:
Fix ConfigureGerrit Task to respect http.sslVerify config parameter

the https protocol and if the repository has http.sslVerfiy configured
to false then this task should respect this and accept connections from
servers which certificates can't be validated.

subject: [scalability] Use image descriptors cache for external programs
message:
[scalability] Use image descriptors cache for external programs

IEditorRegistry uses Program.findProgram() for file types "unknown" to
Eclipse. Unfortunately Program.findProgram() is platform dependent,
requires the caller to run in UI thread and on some platforms can be
really slow => in worst case multiple calls to retrieve image
descriptors via this API will block Eclipse UI for a long time. This
happens e.g. in the History view for commits with thousands of files or
in the Staging view with thousands of staged or unstaged files.

The proposed solution first checks if the editor is external or not, and
than uses a cache for *external* editor image descriptors, which avoids
(for files with the same extension) multiple native calls from UI thread
via IEditorRegistry.getImageDescriptor().

Bug: 464891
Change-Id: Icfbc28916656e8412ca4454046c7cee298ca2c5e
Signed-off-by: Andrey Loskutov <loskutov@gmx.de>

available. Remove dash's eclipse-signing-maven-plugin which we don't

message:
Workaround to enable linking multiple resources to HistoryView

When given a selection the GenericHistoryView only considers the first
element and adapts it to an IResource before passing it on as input. To
work around this behavior the GitHistoryPage now looks at the current
selection itself and uses it as input if preferable.

subject: Don't suggest branch name for push from remote tracking branch
message:
Don't suggest branch name for push from remote tracking branch

The "Push Branch..." wizard suggested a wrong target branch name
prefixed with the remote's name if the selected source branch was a
remote tracking branch. Pushing from a remote tracking branch to the
remote branch it's tracking is pointless. So there's no natural
candidate for the target branch. Hence do not suggest any target branch
if pushing a remote tracking branch.

Also improve texts in PushBranchPage to make them easier to understand.

Bug: 464723
Change-Id: I3aed8c30675f1f75efb700fcf568ef91c877d0b5

subject: ConnectProviderOperation should respect core_autoIgnoreDerivedResources
message:
ConnectProviderOperation should respect core_autoIgnoreDerivedResources

If the project is connected to git, ConnectProviderOperation always
tried to add derived resources to the .gitignore file, independently
which value was set via "core_autoIgnoreDerivedResources" property.

The patch makes sure that if user set "core_autoIgnoreDerivedResources"
property to "false", connecting projects to git will not alter
.gitignore file.

Change-Id: I65c29f1792a54a5890338b86a2a3496007f57c34
Signed-off-by: Andrey Loskutov <loskutov@gmx.de>

subject: Assume path not found by the treewalk as ignored path
message:
Assume path not found by the treewalk as ignored path

RepositoryUtil.isIgnored(path) is used to check if the resource should
be added to the .gitignore by IgnoreDerivedResources and
IgnoreOperation.

However if the TreeWalk can't *find* the path "isIgnored" returns
"false", but probably should return "true" in the same way as if the
mapping were missing.

subject: [test stability] Fix test crash on timeout due running wizard operation
message:
[test stability] Fix test crash on timeout due running wizard operation

Sometimes we are too fast checking the wizard state and fail afterwards
to close it, causing test crash.

If one tries to close wizard dialog while operation is still running,
wizard opens each time a new message dialog with the warning about
running task. This causes SWTBot to give up closing the wizard shell,
but after the timeout of one minute, for each test running after the
current one => the execution will be aborted after 40 minutes timeout.

So before trying to validate search result, give the wizard operation a
chance to complete!

Change-Id: I2287725261a6c012029152d160ba6fae07c9f289
Signed-off-by: Andrey Loskutov <loskutov@gmx.de>

subject: Show user real error cause during repository search task
message:
Show user real error cause during repository search task

Properly handle exceptions (wrap to InvocationTargetException and don't
"hide" to the log), show the real cause in the error message to user.

Change-Id: I60b40607e1f9286f2e49e3f016a408997a47775e
Signed-off-by: Andrey Loskutov <loskutov@gmx.de>

subject: Fixed double size calculation on selecting new diff
message:
Fixed double size calculation on selecting new diff

Do not call resizeCommentAndDiffScrolledComposite() from
controlResized() if we are already during calculation. This halves
execution time. 

Additionally don't call both commentAndDiffComposite.setSize(size) and

subject: Don't run ResourceRefreshJob as Workspace job to avoid resource events
message:
Don't run ResourceRefreshJob as Workspace job to avoid resource events

ResourceRefreshJob is triggered each time user activates Eclipse window,
even if there are no Git configured projects in the workspace and no
changes in configured Git repositories.

Unfortunately even if the job detects that it has nothing to do, it
*always* triggers workspace change events and autobuild job executions.
ResourceRefreshJob is a subclass of InternalWorkspaceJob, so just via
entering runInWorkspace() method a sequence of calls below is always
executed:

workspace.prepareOperation()
workspace.beginOperation()
workspace.endOperation()

The last one always dispatches ResourceChangeEvent to all
IResourceChangeListener's and so triggers also auto build job (which
usually simply doesn't do anything). Although I have no example how it
can cause real harm in production environment, alone debugging the build
process in Eclipse is impossible because of permanent interruptions from
ResourceRefreshJob.

Change-Id: Idc23fd3cf4d71d36b16af2d4855770a4b70927cd
Signed-off-by: Andrey Loskutov <loskutov@gmx.de>

subject: Fix hyperlink display in SpellcheckableMessageArea
message:
Fix hyperlink display in SpellcheckableMessageArea

This is first and foremost a syntax coloring problem, and should be
handled as such. This change implements that:

* Adds a token scanner that recognizes hyperlinks using the configured
  hyperlink detectors.
* Adds a presentation reconciler with a damager/repairer that uses this
  token scanner.
* Gets rid of the overridden hideHyperlinks() method -- if we do proper
  document partitioning, this definitely wrecks havoc.
* Uses SWT.UNDERLINE_LINK to style hyperlink partitions.
* Adds a few unit tests for the tokenizing.
* Adds org.objenesis to required bundles in org.eclipse.egit.ui.test
  to enable mocking.

In my manual UI tests, this syntax-colors hyperlinks nicely in the
staging view, spell-checking works, auto-wrap works, whitespace display
works, the "hand" pointer appears only over hyperlinks, and bug 471355
is solved. It also has no adverse effects on the commit viewer or the
git history view.

subject: Rewrite CommitMessageViewer to use JFace
message:
Rewrite CommitMessageViewer to use JFace

The goal is to get the commit message viewer in the git history view to
use the same (configurable) hyperlink colors and other hyperlink
infrastructure as the SpellcheckableMessageArea. This is complicated by
two things:

* custom hyperlinks to commits with custom opening, and
* no clear model-view separation; getting the data from git,
  formatting, and coloring were all lumped together.

Therefore, improve the model-view separation:

* Get rid of hand-crafted SWT text range coloring. CommitInfoBuilder is
  restricted to getting the data from the repo, formatting, and
  returning semantic information (hyperlinks, header and footer
  ranges). It doesn't do syntax-coloring anymore.
* CommitMessageViewer uses a partitioning on its document to split it
  logically into header, body, and footer. It also gets a custom
  hyperlink detector to deal with the custom commit hyperlinks.
* GitHistoryPage uses a presentation reconciler with damager/repairers
  that know how to syntax-color each partition (and hyperlinks).
* Made the HyperlinkTokenScanner a bit more flexible to rebuild the
  italicizing of Signed-off-by footer lines. Fixed a bug along the way
  (if "fill paragraphs" was on, it would put footer lines onto one
  line).

Visually, there are no changes except the colors of hyperlinks, which
now follow SpellcheckableMessageArea and are configurable.

subject: Improve performance of HyperlinkTokenScanner
message:
Improve performance of HyperlinkTokenScanner

My initial implementation of this was too inefficient. It invoked the
HyperlinkDetectors for every character, which effectively re-introduced
bug 415537 and made editing long commit messages with only a few links
a pain.

Therefore, compute all hyperlinks on a line and cache them once
computed. Use this cache while we're on that line, and re-compute it
when the current position passes to a new line.

Add an internal subclass of the standard URL hyperlink detector
org.eclipse.jface.text.hyperlink.URLHyperlinkDetector because that one
is only capable of finding hyperlinks at the start of the region.
Others, like those from mylyn, do find all links in a region on their
own.

Change-Id: I464f321d5f5d62836d031615b0c6252a54ee893f
Signed-off-by: Thomas Wolf <thomas.wolf@paranor.ch>

subject: Configurable date format used consistently throughout EGit
message:
Configurable date format used consistently throughout EGit

Part 1: UI and use it in history view.

* New DateFormatPreferencePage.
* New UI preferences.
* New PreferenceBasedDateFormatter.
* Changed all uses of GitDateFormatter and DateFormat to use the new
  PreferenceBasedDateFormatter.
* The only fixed format is ISO for the hovers in commit graph tables.

Some implementation notes:
* The default format is the custom format (already existing DATE_FORMAT
  preference. Reasons: this is a reasonable (local) format, and if
  the user had configured something there, it will still be used. Keep
  surprises for the user at a minimum.
* PreferenceBasedDateFormatter is a subtype of GitDateFormatter to keep
  changes at a minimum. It also helps in the views where the user can
  explicitly force RELATIVE dates.
* The old date format (under "Label Decorations/Other/DateFormat")
  preference UI has been removed.
* Where we use label providers, make those listen to preference changes
  related to their labels (dates, showing e-mails), not the viewers.
  The label providers fire an event when their state changes, users
  can just listen on those events. Limits the proliferation of checking
  specific preferences, and simplifies some code.
* Otherwise, views or viewers refresh on date format preference
  changes.
* This commit also fixes
   - bug 339797 (custom format for date column in history view),
   - bug 477151 (preference page silently ignores incorrect date
     formats)

subject: [nested projects] Allow EGit request inner most projects in some cases
message:
[nested projects] Allow EGit request inner most projects in some cases

Currently Eclipse resources API offers the choice of having very fast
but unpredictable results (getFileForLocation()) or very slow but
deterministic (findFilesForLocationURI()) while requesting a file via
IPath key in context of nested projects. The "unpredictability" of the
fast API is not documented and has side effects only if workspace
contains nested projects - in this case if the file is located in many
projects, it is not guaranteed, file handle from which project will be
returned (it is related to project names, see bug 476585).

During the fix for bug 440722, by choosing the very fast file lookup for
ResourceUtil we unintentionally changed the EGit behavior so that in
case nested projects were involved, EGit sometimes could not use the
file from the inner most project, but from parent one.

This fix offers an explicit option for clients which would prefer to see
resources from inner most projects independently how long it takes to
resolve them. Some of the affected ResourceUtil API clients are changed
to always request files inner most projects: mostly editor/compare
related code.

subject: Use all available space in RebaseInteractiveView

Use all available space in RebaseInteractiveView

This resolves a TODO in RebaseInteractiveView: if the dynamic columns
need less space than available horizontally, there will be be a large
unused empty space at the right. Can happen if the view is wide, or
commit messages are short, or for instance also in the view is opened
without input (just open it via the quick access).

The solution is to redistribute all available space after pack() using
a TreeColumnLayout with ColumnWeightData and the sizes obtained after
packing.

As a result, the table uses at least all the available horizontal space
and may (as before) use more if the columns don't fit (which then gives
a horizontal scroll bar, also as before).

subject: Alleviate problems on case-insensitive file systems
message:
Alleviate problems on case-insensitive file systems

We have _no_ foolproof way to correctly compare paths:

* IPath treats paths always case-insensitively, both in equals()
  and in isPrefixOf(), which can give rise to unexpected problems
  on case-insensitive file systems such as NTFS on Windows or HFS+
  on OS X.
* java.io.File considers HFS+ (Mac) a case-sensitive UnixFileSystem,
  which is incorrect. (HFS+ can be either, and by default on Macs
  is case-insensitive.) On Windows, File is indeed case-insensitive.
* java.nio.file.Path also uses a case-sensitive sun.nio.fs.UnixPath
  on HFS+. On Windows, it is case-insensitive.
* org.eclipse.jgit.util.FS_POSIX.isCaseSensitive() returns
  unconditionally false for Macs. However, HFS+ partitions _can_ be
  case-sensitive. Furthermore, org.eclipse.jgit.util.FS doesn't have
  operations for case-normalization.
* org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project sets the project location
  to the canonicalized file path. File.getCanonicalFile() does appear
  to normalize capitalization to the form actually used in the file
  system.
* Many places in EGit do path comparisons between Eclipse IResources
  and git working trees using any of the possibilities above.
  
Options to fix this are:
* Use java.io.File or java.nio.file.Path, but that would leave HFS+ out
  in the cold. Would require lots of changes throughout EGit to root
  out any uses of comparisons via IPath.
* Write our own comparison and prefix methods. Make sure only those are
  used. Any collections storing paths or files would need to be checked
  and adapted; or maybe we'd even need or own subclass of File...
* Ensure that we use for repositories only the canonical path, like
  Eclipse core does for IProjects, so that the same casing is used.

This change implements the latter. It ensures that EGit and the
Eclipse resource tree both have the same idea of where things are and
should thus resolve most case-sensitivity problems, even if IPath is
used.

subject: RespositorySearchDialog: correctly detect already added repositories
message:
RespositorySearchDialog: correctly detect already added repositories

In commit 2f9171f we started using the canonical path for repositories
because org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project uses that, so that
EGit and the Eclipse resource tree have the same idea of where projects
are. Otherwise EGit did not detect all projects belonging to a
repository.

However, this broke the detection of already imported repositories in
the RespositorySearchDialog. I had missed that because this dialog uses
always case-sensitive string comparisons for file paths, but none of
the other usual methods to compare paths (IPath, File, Path).

To fix this, we now compare both the absolute path (as before) _and_
the canonical path. This correctly catches both repositories added with
a non-canonical path as well as repositories added with a canonical
path.

The display has been left unchanged; I considered it too confusing
for the user if he entered a directory, but the list would display
potentially different canonical paths. Also resetting the directory
input to the canonical path might have been rather surprising.

As far as I see this is the only place in EGit UI where plain strings
are used as paths.

the staging view on an unstaged file that doesn't belong to an open
project, there are no IResourceChangeEvents, and since the file is
unstaged, there is no IndexChangeEvent either. So we need to trigger

subject: Implement isSynchronized() in LocalNonWorkspaceTypedElement
message:
Implement isSynchronized() in LocalNonWorkspaceTypedElement

To solve bug 481682, we'll use a LocalNonWorkspaceTypedElement to show
a diff on a file not in any open Eclipse project. The super class
implements isSynchronized() only for accessible workspace resources via
the Eclipse resource tree. We need to handle it ourselves here,
otherwise any attempt to save from the compare editor will pop up a
dialog falsely claiming the file had been modified outside of the
compare editor.

The implementation is closely modeled after the one in the super class,
but using the file system's last-modified timestamp directly instead of
going through the Eclipse resource tree, which would always give -1L
for such inaccessible resources.

message:

used by Eclipse for editing files which are located outside workspace.

If the URI returned by the IURIEditorInput represents a valid file path,

This makes diffs from the staging view work even for files

any project, such as a global .gitignore).

Repository view used a different but very similar implementation for
opening editors as Staging view. The difference is that the Staging view
always opened default text editor on external files, and Repository view
allows IDE decide which editor is more suitable. The later one is better
because user will usually get the right editor for the file (e.g. Java

subject: Follow JGit, use org.eclipse.jgit.annotations.Nullable in EGit too
message:
Follow JGit, use org.eclipse.jgit.annotations.Nullable in EGit too

Since the commit deb853cb691caf55affe1e4fbfad29b670591140 jgit uses its
own Nullable annotation type, so JDT fails to catch NP violations in
EGit code which uses default Nullable type from JDT. This looks like a
bug in JDT NP analysis, but till it is fixed we better use the JGit
version of Nullable. Other annotations aren't affected yet, since JGit
didn't defined it's own version of NonNull and NonNullByDefault.

subject: Start new rule with \n if ignore file exists but not in the workspace
message:
Start new rule with \n if ignore file exists but not in the workspace

The best example I've seen why the code should never ever use
conditional expressions without curly braces. The missing braces and
wrong else block indentation suggested that the "ignoreLine" should be
prepended with a new line in case the file already exists and does not
ends with a new line. The reality was that the "else" block was
following not the first but the second "if", and so the code never did
what requested and ignore file was corrupted with a new ignore rule
added on the same line as the last ignore rule. OMG!

To reproduce, create an ignore file which ends with an ignore rule
without terminating new line. Make sure the files to ignore are outside
the workspace and try to ignore them from the repositories view.

subject: Fix GitModelObject adaptation to IResource
message:
Fix GitModelObject adaptation to IResource

A GitModelObject returns the full absolute path to the object in the git
working tree. Using that for IWorkspaceRoot.getFile() creates a resource
with that as path, not as location. Which result in all deleted
resources having bogus paths in the Git Model of the Synchronize View.

This change maps back the git absolute path to a workspace-relative path
that can then safely be used with IWorkspaceRoot.getFile().

Adapting a GitModelObject to an IResource will work only for files
actually in the Eclipse workspace. Changing that so that it works also
for files in the working tree, but not in the workspace is _not_ fixed
by this change.

Change-Id: Ie539c3ad46f3f48ac6f01a365d20ceacd8952564
Signed-off-by: Thomas Wolf <thomas.wolf@paranor.ch>

subject: Properly clean up caches when a configured repository is removed
message:
Properly clean up caches when a configured repository is removed

When a repository is removed, it was never removed from the
IndexDiffCache, which in fact has no operation to remove anything. Only
the preference in ResourceUtil is updated. This of course in turn means
there's a hard reference in IndexDiffCache to the repo, and it thus also
remains in the RepositoryCache indefinitely (unless it is really
deleted, not just removed from the view).

Clean this up:

1. IndexDiffCache listens on changes to the preference storing the
   configured repositories and removes any stale cache entries upon
   changes.
2. Individual cache entries really clear all listeners, and cancel
   their jobs when disposed.
3. The RepositoryCache also listens on that preference and also removes
   stale entries proactively. Using weak references is a nice touch,
   but relying on the GC to clean up is not really necessary here.

Bug: 483664
Change-Id: I8c20d4e8821e6c5d9fa7e62191a79275bef58bce
Signed-off-by: Thomas Wolf <thomas.wolf@paranor.ch>

subject: Fix labeling when Repository View is not open
message:
Fix labeling when Repository View is not open

The ResourceStateFactory must not rely exclusively on the ResourceCache
to find repositories. That cache is not guaranteed to contain all
configured repositories at all times. Only while the repository view is
open we can rely on the cache to contain all configured repositories.

Instead, use RepositoryMapping.getMapping, and fall back to the cache
only when that doesn't find anything.

This is a general problem with this cache. The RepositoryCache is
populated by three code paths:

* RepositoryMapping.getMapping() -- on-demand-load; no hard reference
  is retained permanently in general.
* Auto-sharing in the core Activator -- on-demand-load; no hard
  reference is retained permanently.
* The content provider of the Repositories View -- full load; hard
  reference kept as long as the view is open.

The fix here is minimal. A more complete fix would be to make
RepositoryCache.getRepository(IPath) demand-load missing configured
repositories. I _do_ have an implementation for that, too, but that
needs more testing.

subject: Avoid expensive property tester evaluations
message:
Avoid expensive property tester evaluations

The GitFlow property tester tests the presence of certain values in the
git config. Accessing the git config incurs three file accesses to get
the last-modified times of the system, user, and repo config files to
determine whether they have changed, and if so, to reload them. These
are potentially slow operations involving file I/O. Even just getting
the last-modified time apparently can be expensive, for instance if the
user config is on a non-local file system.

The GitFlow property testers were based on the current selection and
thus were re-evaluated by the Eclipse framework whenever the current
selection changed, including text selections. The text selection may
change on each keypress. This could lead to very noticeable delays if
access to the last-modified time of a config file was slow.

I don't see an easy way to improve the handling of config files. The
other approach to minimize the overhead of property testers is to
minimize the number of times they're re-evaluated. Since the GitFlow
property testers are not really interested in the current selection
but in a derived property of that (the current repository), this
change provides this current repository as a variable in the
IEvaluationContext and makes the property tester use that new variable.
As a result, the tests are only re-evaluated when the current selection
changes such that the current repository changes. Keypresses and text
selection changes in an editor no longer trigger re-evaluations of the
GitFlow property tests.

The current repository is still determined on each selection change.
However,

* this is normally a relatively fast operation as the repository is
  already cached most of the time, 
* the repository is determined only once in the source provider instead
  of again and again in each property test.

subject: Minimize accessing the persistent property for the GitProvider
message:
Minimize accessing the persistent property for the GitProvider

Accessing persistent properties may be expensive, and may block if
other threads manipulate the same persistent property bucket. (For
instance, JDT initialization does set persistent properties for source
attachments.)

Therefore, if we didn't find a GitProvider through the session property,
let's first check whether the project is already scheduled for mapping
in the MappingJob. If so, we do know:

* the project is indeed a Git project (some thread tested the persistent
  property already), and
* we don't need to test the persistent property again, and
* we don't need to try to schedule the project for mapping again.

This should significantly reduce the number of accesses to that
persistent property for projects that indeed have a GitProvider.

To reduce the number of persistent property accesses for unshared
projects, re-implement part of the corresponding logic in
RepositoryProvider, which is unfortunately private. Note: this works
because mapping a repository provider creates the session property
first, and we reset our own "marked as unshared" property whenever we
do find a provider (any one will do).

Signed-off-by: Thomas Wolf <thomas.wolf@paranor.ch>

message:
Improve performance of SelectionUtils.getRepository()

Instead of converting selected elements to an IPath location always
and then using RepositoryMapping.getRepository(IPath), try to keep as
much info as needed and as possible: if the selection contains
IResources, use their projects and the much more efficient
RepositoryMApping.getRepository(IProject).

In my tests on a test workspace with 46 open projects and the git
toolbar and global menu enabled, this results in a speedup of the
SelectionUtils.getRepository(IStructuredSelection) operation by a
factor of 10 to 20 in most cases.

subject: Do not autofill clone wizard for arbitrary input
message:
Do not autofill clone wizard for arbitrary input

The clone wizard would auto-fill also if the clipboard contained
arbitrary, non-git related HTTP(S) URLs. This is a regression that was
introduced in commit 39f3c68.

Remove the tests for HTTP protocols. They are allowed anyway by the
general test that the clipboard content ends in .git.

Also consider only clipboard content up to the first whitespace (after
having removed a potential "git clone" prefix). Formerly, we stopped at
the first blank, not general whitespace, and would thus autofill even
with multi-line clipboard content like

  foobar
  baz
  .git

(No blank in there, just line endings.)

Finally, add missing braces and remove a spurious trim() call.

Commit 4e89050 inadvertently introduced the restriction that all
resources in the selection be in one repository. However, AddToIndex,
RemoveFromIndex, and Ignore previously also worked if projects from
different repositories were selected.

Remove the restriction on a single repository from the
ResourceStatePropertyTester, and simplify the isEnabled() of AddToIndex
and RemoveFromIndex action handlers a bit.

The ResourceStatePropertyTester is currently used only for these
commands in the Team context menu. If is ever to be used with some
command for which all resources really must be from one repository, it
can be combined with the "resourcesSingleRepository" property test.

Performance should not suffer as all repository or index diff operations
in the property tester operate on caches.
